title: sperm_whale
body:
A species of [[whale]]. Scientific name: [i]Physeter macrocephalus[/i]. It is both the largest toothed whale and predator, at an average of 16 meters (52 feet) long and weighing 50 tons.

They are notable for hunting down [[squid]]s when diving at the deep sea, particularly the [[giant squid]].

title: mysterious_ranmaru_x_(fate)
body:
Avenger-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Debuted in the GUDAGUDA Close Call 2021 event. Their real name is Mori Ranmaru, the younger brother of [[Mori Nagayoshi (fate)|]] who served as [[Oda Nobunaga (fate)|]]'s retainer.

In Fate, their gender is listed as unknown, similar to characters like [[Enkidu (fate)|]] and [[Chevalier d'Eon (fate)|]]. However, unlike Enkidu and Chevalier d'Eon, who are truly gender-neutral within the game, [[Mysterious Ranmaru X (Fate)|]] is referred to as a female.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Mika Pikazo]] 
[b]Voice Actress[/b]: [[Saitou Machiko]]

title: uiharu_kazari
body:
Character from the anime/manga series [[ToAru Kagaku No Railgun]]. She is a friend of [[Shirai Kuroko]] and a classmate of [[Saten Ruiko]].

Kazari's ability as an esper is limited to keeping lunches warm by using her Level 1 Thermal Hand to keep things at constant temperature. However, she is infamous as a fearsome hacker, nicknamed "Goalkeeper", and is invaluable as an asset of Judgment and Kuroko's primary operator.

* [b]Physical traits[/b]: [[short hair]], [[black hair]], [[brown eyes]], [[small breasts]]
* [b]Clothing/accessories[/b]: [[Sakugawa School uniform]], [[flower wreath]], [[head wreath]]

title: shirai_kuroko
body:
A character from the light novel series [[Toaru Majutsu No Index]] and its spin-off manga series [[Toaru Kagaku No Railgun]].

Roommate of [[Misaka Mikoto]] and member of "Judgement", Academy City's student-based disciplinary committee. Kuroko is a Level 4 esper with the power to instantly teleport herself or items in her possession. Has an almost obsession-like crush on Mikoto, much to the latter's annoyance.

title: baby_bowser
body:
[[Bowser]] as a child, introduced in [i][[Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island]][/i]. A spoiled, petulant prince that throws tantrums to get what he wants. In this form he is mostly seen antagonizing the [[Yoshi|Yoshis]]. [[Kamek]] is seemingly his caretaker and attempts to appease all of his demanding needs.

Since the release of [i][[Mario & Luigi: Partners in Time]][/i], the designs of Baby Bowser and Bowser Jr. have become almost identical. The only major difference is in the [[white bandana]] that is worn by Bowser Jr., as either Baby Bowser does not have one or his is just plainly white without the drawing of the mouth and teeth.

Not to be confused with [[Bowser Jr.]]

title: yue_ying_(shin_sangoku_musou)
body:
[[Shin Sangoku Musou]]/Dynasty Warriors's portrayal of Lady Huang, [[Zhuge Liang]]'s wife.

Her classic appearance makes her clothed in armor and gives her dark auburn hair, as an homage to the challenge she gave to her suitors in folklore (she claimed she was ugly, that she had tanned skin, red hair...), and she is armed with a dagger-axe or "ge".

Her modern appearance varies between games. Her early appearance in [i][[Shin Sangoku Musou 5]][/i] gives her a lighter red hair color, somewhat tanned skin, a facial mark and she is armed either with a bow or a crossbow/dagger gauntlet weapon (termed the "blade bow") that she presumably invented.

Her later appearances toned down her hair color (now a light auburn) and her skin color. In [i][[Shin Sangoku Musou 6]][/i], she is armed either with a staff or her classic dagger-axe. In [i][[Shin Sangoku Musou 7|7]][/i], it's either her dagger-axe or the blade bow.

Regardless, she is always portrayed as a brilliant inventor. The wood oxen, the juggernauts and the various animal-like weapons she spawns in her musous all came from her inventive mind in the games.

title: nissin_cup_noodle
body:
[b]Cup Noodle[/b] (known as "Cup Noodles" outside Japan, or colloquially "Nissin Cup Noodle"/"Nissin Cup Noodles" to distinguish it from other noodle brands) is a brand of cup noodles by [[Nissin]].

This tag is specifically used for the Nissin line of cup noodle/ramen products (including classic, chili tomato, seafood, shio, curry, miso, "mystery meat":[https://soranews24.com/2017/09/20/the-true-identity-of-cup-noodles-mystery-meat/], tom yum goong, spicy, etc., featuring their big/mini versions, rich versions, variants, such as cheese curry, Hokkaido milk seafood or negi shio, or international exclusive types if they exist), or [[brand name imitation|imitations]] of their packaging. Only tag [[cup ramen]] if other cup noodle brands are present.

h4. Flavors
* [[nissin cup noodle seafood]]

h4. See also

* [[HUNGRY DAYS]]
* [[CUPNOODLES MUSEUM]]

h4. External links

* "Cup Noodles official website (US)":[http://www.nissinfoods.com/products/CupNoodles]
* Product listings: JP ("Nissin":[https://www.nissin.com/jp/products/brands/cupnoodle/], "Cup Noodle":[https://www.cupnoodle.jp/products/]), CN ("Nissin":[https://www.nissinfoods.com.hk/tch/products/cup-noodles]), US ("Cup Noodles":[https://www.nissinfoods.com/company/cup-noodles/]), EU ("Cup Noodles":[https://de.nissin-foods.eu/cupnoodles/en/products/], "SoraNews24":[https://soranews24.com/2021/09/30/how-do-european-cup-noodles-taste-to-a-japanese-palate/])

title: hank_pym
body: Dr. Henry Jonathan Pym is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by penciller Jack Kirby, editor-plotter Stan Lee and writer Larry Lieber, Pym debuted in Tales to Astonish #27 (January 1962). He returned several issues later as the original iteration of [[Ant-Man]], a superhero with the power to shrink to the size of an ant. He later assumed other superhero identities, including the size-changing Giant-Man and Goliath; the insect-themed Yellowjacket; and briefly, the Wasp. He is a founding member of [[Avengers (series)|the Avengers]] superhero team, and the creator of the robotic villain [[Ultron]]. He is also the ex-husband of [[Janet van Dyne]] and the father of Nadia van Dyne, his daughter by his first wife, Maria Pym.

title: cruz_azul
body: Club de Futbol Cruz Azul, commonly referred to as Cruz Azul, is a professional football club based in [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]]. It competes in the [[Liga MX]], the top tier of Mexican football. Founded in 1927 in Jasso, Hidalgo, the club officially moved to Mexico City in 1971, where it had already registered a great presence and activity since its beginnings. Estadio Azteca, the nation's largest sports venue, served as their home venue until 1996, when they moved to the Estadio Ciudad de los Deportes, which was renamed Estadio Azul. After 22 years, the team returned to the Azteca following the conclusion of the 2017–18 Liga MX season. Its headquarters are in La Noria, a suburb within [[Xochimilco]] in the southern part of Mexico City.

title: high-waist_sideboob
body:
An outfit with a high-waist style or bonded by something(like [[underbust]], [[obi]]...) around below the bust, and baring the side skin above the waistline.(Also the area around "Serratus anterior muscle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serratus_anterior_muscle )
It also can be a [[backless outfit]], and often expose the [[sideboob]] or [[armpits]].

Basically, the exposed side should go at least as low as the underbust line but not all the way down to the waist (hence "high-waist").

title: kizuna_ai
body:
The world's premier [[Virtual YouTuber]]. She uploads a variety of videos to her YouTube channel, the A.I. Channel, in a similar format to other popular YouTubers. She's produced by activ8 under their [[Kizuna AI Inc.]] autonomous subsidiary.

Her character designer is [[Morikura En]] (post #2638467), while her [[voice actor]] was kept a secret (until April 24, 2020 when it was revealed that [spoiler]Kasuga Nozomi[/spoiler] was her "voice model"). She made her debut with the video [i]"Creating A Twitter account!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EoPFGj3uuYo][/i] on November 29, 2016. Her 3D model is available for "download":[http://kizunaai.com/download-page/] from her official website. 

She describes herself as a 16 year-old super intelligent A.I. that is curious about humans. As the sole resident of an endless white void, she finds human life fascinating, and wishes to use her channel to learn more about them. In a "live stream":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C3Fx-9s9Y68] celebrating a new subscriber milestone, Kizuna Ai gave her impression of her own three-sizes: 83-56-81.

As of February 26, 2022, Kizuna Ai is on indefinite hiatus following a final [i]hello, world[/i] virtual concert. At the final live, an [[kizuna no allele|anime project]] and a [[CeVIO]] voicebank ([[KZN (cevio)|]]) based on her were announced.

Kizuna has had an immense amount of game collabs, including an appearance as a shipgirl in [[Azur Lane]], an unlockable [[Fall Guy]] skin in [[Fall Guys]], and an appearance as a playable pilot in [[Super Mecha Champions]]. activ8 has also ensured she had collaborations with crypto ventures, such as Otaku Coin and Japanese metaverse/NFT project METAANI, as well as previously having talked about Bitcoin, which is met with mild controversy among anti-crypto western fans.

title: nekomiya_hinata
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber]] who made her debut on Twitter, February 10, 2018. Initially independent, she joined the group [[ENTUM]], alongside with [[Mirai Akari]] and several others. Her exceptional skill at first-person shooters quickly made her one of the top five most popular virtual YouTubers. After ENTUM's closure on December 31, 2019 she went back to being an indie and additional members were added to her channel.

title: prowler_goku_(meme)
body:
[B]Prowler Goku[/b] is a meme that utilizes the image of [[Son Goku]] on [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse|Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2]]'s boxart set in a more intimidating light. This is usually accompanied by [[prowler (marvel)|Prowler]]'s theme from [[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse|Into the Spider-Verse]], but some variants lack it. Variants of this meme include a version with a [[child]] in the foreground whose mouth is being covered by a hand with the Goku image in the background and the image itself set with a caption.

title: flannery_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Flannery[/b], known as [b]Asuna[/b] (アスナ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

A Gym Leader with a fiery, brave personality, she can be a bit too serious and sometimes tries too hard to conduct herself properly [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Torkoal]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]]. In her [[pokemon rse|RSE]] outfit, she wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[black shirt|black]] [[cropped shirt|shirt]], [[denim]] [[jeans]] with a [[red belt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. In her [[pokemon oras|ORAS]] outfit, she wears a [[red bandeau]] under a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[black shirt]] which is [[tied shirt|tied]] to bare her [[midriff]], [[green pants]] with a [[white belt]], and black shoes.

title: aether_foundation_employee
body:
The Aether Foundation (Japanese: エーテル財団 Aether Foundation) is an organization based in the Alola region whose goal is to cure hurt Pokémon. The organization shelters Pokémon to keep them safe from threats like Team Skull. Their headquarters is Aether Paradise, an artificial island they constructed.

title: archie_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Archie[/b], known as [b]Aogiri[/b] (アオギリ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

As the leader of Team Aqua, Archie aims to create an ideal world for Pokémon. He has a wild, outgoing personality and has earned the trust of his subordinates [tn](official bio)[/tn].

In his [[pokemon oras|ORAS]] outfit, he has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[black eyes]], and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] including a [[beard]]. He wears a [[blue bandana|blue]] [[logo]] bandana, an [[anchor necklace]], a [[torn bodysuit|torn]] [[blue bodysuit|blue]] [[multicolored bodysuit|and]] [[white bodysuit|white]] [[wetsuit]], and a [[waist cape|caped]] [[yellow belt|yellow]] [[chain belt|belt]].

body:
[b]Ghetsis Harmonia Gropius[/b], known as [b]G-Cis Harmonia Gropius[/b] (ゲーチス・ハルモニア・グロピウス) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon bw|Black and White]][/i].

The mastermind behind Team Plasma and its true leader. He is a cold and calculating master manipulator who once tried to use N to take over the world [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

He has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with an [[ahoge]]. In his [[pokemon bw2|BW2]] outfit, he wears a [[red-tinted eyewear|red]] [[eyepiece]] over his right eye, a [[high collar]] [[cloak]], two [[gold bracelet|gold]] [[bracelet|bracelets]], and carries a [[cane]] with the Team Plasma [[logo]] on it.

title: glinda
body: Glinda is a fictional character created by L. Frank Baum for his Oz novels. She first appears in Baum's 1900 children's classic [[the wizard of oz|The Wonderful Wizard of Oz]], and is the most powerful sorceress in the Land of Oz, ruler of the Quadling Country South of the Emerald City, and protector of Princess Ozma.

title: lusamine_(pokemon)
body:
Character in [[pokemon sm|Pokémon Sun and Moon]]. President of the Aether Foundation. Despite her youthful appearance, she's over 41 years old.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] worn [[hair over one eye|over one eye]]. She wears a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[white legwear|white]] open foot [[leggings]] and [[high heels]]. She has [[yellow nails|yellow]] [[nail polish]] and has a [[diamond_(shape)|diamond-shaped]] [[green gemstone|emerald]] on her chest.

In the game, she is [spoiler]the mother of [[Lillie_(pokemon)|]] and [[Gladion (pokemon)|]], and the true antagonist of the game.[/spoiler]

In the [[pokemon sm (anime)|Sun & Moon anime]], she is [spoiler]not an antagonist, but her overbearing demeanor and dedication to her work put her at odds with Lillie.[/spoiler]

title: donkey_kong_3
body:
The third game in the [i][[donkey_kong_(series)|Donkey Kong series]][/i] and the final Donkey Kong arcade game, released in 1983. Unlike [[donkey_kong_(1981_game)|Donkey Kong]] and [[donkey_kong_jr._(game)|Donkey Kong Jr.]] this game is not a platformer, but something more akin to a "Shoot 'em Up". With your bug sprayer you must chase away [[Donkey Kong]] and the bugs in order to protect your flowers in the greenhouse. 

Notable for being the only game in the Donkey Kong arcade series to not feature [[Mario]]. Instead the game's protagonist is [[stanley_(donkey_kong)|Stanley]], the character from the 1982 [[Game & Watch]] title [i]Greenhouse[/i] of which Donkey Kong 3 is based on.

title: toadsworth
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario]] franchise. He is an [[old|elderly]] [[Toad (mario)|]] who serves as [[Princess Peach]]'s steward and caretaker. He first appeared in [i][[Super Mario Sunshine]][/i] and is often seen worrying about Peach's safety and well-being, and sometimes assists [[Mario]] and [[Luigi]] on their adventures. He has a distinctive British accent and a large white [[mustache]].

h4. Official Art
* !post #6102014

title: mario_vs._donkey_kong_2:_march_of_the_minis
body:
Sequel to [[Mario vs. Donkey Kong]], released on the [[Nintendo DS]]. Unlike the previous entry, it forgoes the ability to directly control [[Mario]] and the platforming gameplay in order for the player to guide the [[Mini-Mario|Mini-Marios]] to puzzle solve through stages full of obstacles  with the [[touchscreen|touch screen]] instead.

This entry is notable for revitalizing [[Pauline_(mario)|Pauline]], bringing her back into the Mario franchise and intertwining her again in the Mario & [[Donkey Kong]] rivalry after a 12 year absence, reprising her role as the kidnapped damsel in distress. She still keeps her redesign that she received from [[donkey_kong_(game_boy)|Donkey Kong (Game Boy)]] relatively unchanged.

title: mario_vs._donkey_kong

title: hasaera_rabi
body:
A boss character in [[Toushin Toshi II]] and its remake, [[Toushin Toshi Girls Gift]].

In the original game, Hasaera Rabi is a strict, hot-blooded [[angel]] knight who holds borderline xenophobic views of her enemies, but uses her hot blooded nature to disguise her truly cowardly nature. In Girl's Gift, however, her character is modified. While she is still an Angel Knight, she is far more calm and rational than her original counterpart, but still hides a cowardly nature beneath the surface. She also now possesses the epithet "Blade Angel," after the sword she wields in battle.

In the original game, she has [[long hair|long]], [[pink hair]] and [[green eyes]], with a [[circlet]] around her forehead. She possesses a pair of [[angel wings]] and wears a [[green shirt]] with a [[green skirt]], with a gap exposing her midriff. In Girls Gift, her design is drastically changed to give her [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], with her [[hair over one eye]]. She now wears blue [[elbow gloves]] and a [[halterneck]], and her top exposes far more [[cleavage]].

body:

A first year student at Shuujin Academy and an accomplished gymnast, transferring to the school at the same time as [[Amamiya Ren|the protagonist]].

[spoilers]She is actually [[Yoshizawa Sumire|Sumire]], Kasumi's younger sister, living as her due to the efforts of [[Maruki Takuto]]. [[yoshizawa kasumi's sister|Kasumi herself]] died in a car accident from protecting Sumire prior to the events of the game.
For tagging purposes, this tag only applies to the party member and [i]not[/i] the real Kasumi.[/spoilers]

title: morgana_(persona_5)
body:
[[Persona 5]] character. Voiced by [[Ootani Ikue]] (JP) / [[Cassandra Lee Morris]] (EN) / [spoiler][[Bryce Papenbrook]] (EN, [[Morgana (human) (Persona 5)|human form]])[/spoiler].

The most mysterious member of the Phantom Thieves. Childlike in height, his appearance imitates that of [[Morgana (cat) (Persona 5)|a black cat]], but his true identity is completely unknown. It looks like he's wearing something on his head, but…? That is all the information we currently have. It looks like the black cat is often seen going around with the [[amamiya ren|protagonist]].

title: sakamoto_ryuuji
body:
[[Persona 5]] character. Voiced by [[Miyano Mamoru]] (JP) / Max Mittelman (EN).

Just like the [[amamiya ren|protagonist]], he is a 16-year-old, second-year student at Shujin High School. He stands out with his wild behavior and seems to be a "problem child" even within the school. More than often, his problematic behavior imposes on the hospitality of the school's teachers and advisers. He previously did not behave the way he currently does, but the origin of his bad behavior is currently unknown.

Wears a [[backless outfit|backless]] [[black vest|black]] [[halterneck]] [[vest]] over her [[white shirt|white]] [[shuujin academy school uniform|uniform]] [[turtleneck]], though it is often misdrawn due to confusion about the [[overalls]]-style buckles on the neck strap.

title: rebuild_of_evangelion
body:
A retelling of the [[neon_genesis_evangelion|original anime series]] that aired in the mid 90's. It features new footage, animation, 3D cg, and a new female character named [[Makinami Mari Illustrious]]. It also changes [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]]'s name to Shikinami Asuka Langley.
 Hideaki Anno served as the writer and general manager of the project, with Kazuya Tsurumaki, Masayuki, Mahiro Maeda and Katsuichi Nakayama directing the films themselves. Yoshiyuki Sadamoto, Ikuto Yamashita and Shirō Sagisu returned to provide character designs, mechanical designs and music respectively.

title: prince_charming_(shrek)
body: Prince Charming is the secondary antagonist in the DreamWorks film, [[Shrek 2]] and the main antagonist in its 2007 sequel, Shrek the Third. He is son of the Fairy Godmother who expected to be Fiona's rescuer until that plan was disrupted by [[Shrek]].

title: pinocchio
body: Pinocchio is a fictional character and the protagonist of the children's novel, The Adventures of Pinocchio (1883) by Italian writer Carlo Collodi of Florence, Tuscany. Pinocchio was carved by a woodcarver named Geppetto in a Tuscan village. He is created as a wooden puppet, but he dreams of becoming a real boy. He is known for his long nose, which grows when he lies.

title: grimace_shake_(meme)
body:
The Grimace Shake is a limited edition berry flavored milkshake dessert that was originally sold at some [[McDonald's]] restaurants in the United States of America during June 2023 to celebrate [[Grimace (mcdonald's)|]]'s "birthday" (read: anniversary of debut). Around the time the shake debuted, social media sites such as Twitter and TikTok became populated with jokes about the drink either being toxic or leading to misfortune due to its resemblance to the recreational drug "lean":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lean_(drug)] or "purple drank".

h4. External links

* KnowYourMeme: "Grimace's Birthday / Grimace Shake":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/events/grimaces-birthday-grimace-shake, "Grimace Shake Trend":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/grimace-shake-trend

title: the_shape_of_water
body: The Shape of Water is a 2017 romantic fantasy film directed and produced by [[Guillermo del Toro]], who co-wrote the screenplay with Vanessa Taylor. It stars Sally Hawkins, Michael Shannon, Richard Jenkins, Doug Jones, Michael Stuhlbarg, and Octavia Spencer. Set in 1962 Baltimore, Maryland, the film follows a mute cleaner at a high-security government laboratory who falls in love with a captured humanoid amphibian creature and decides to help him escape from death at the hands of an evil colonel. Filming took place on location in Ontario, Canada, from August to November 2016.

title: light_cruiser_princess
body:
A boss-tier special enemy character in [[Kantai Collection]]. 

Like many [[abyssal ship]]s, she has [[pale skin]], and [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]]. Unlike most Abyssals, she notably has [[parted bangs]], and an all-black version of the [[dress]], [[boots]] and [[elbow gloves]] that a [i][[Sendai (kancolle)|Sendai]][/i]-class would wear, replete with single-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turrets]], although her left arm is dominated by a large toothy maw bearing [[torpedo]] launchers and a glowing orb.  Another salient point is that she wears a bondage-style [[blindfold]] over her eyes with two curly [[horns]] sticking out of them.

The character design is an unmistakable reference to [[Jintsuu (kancolle)|Jintsuu]], and considering the event, is a reference to the IJN [i]Jintsuu[/i]'s sinking in the "Battle of Kolombangara":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Kolombangara], where [i]Jintsuu[/i] remained behind to let the destroyers escape, winding up being completely destroyed (split in half by torpedoes) by the Allied attack force.

title: hatakaze_(kancolle)
body:
Hatakaze (旗風, lit. "flag wind") is the fifth of the nine [[kamikaze (kancolle)|Kamikaze]]-class destroyers as represented in [[Kantai Collection]]. 

h4. Appearance

Similar to her sister-ships, she wears a [[Meiji schoolgirl uniform]] with a loose gold [[haori]] over a white [[kimono]] top along dark grey-blue [[hakama short skirt]] tied with a sash bearing an [[anchor]] on the end, and [[brown footwear|brown]], [[lace-up boots|laced]], [[knee_boots|knee-high]], leather [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[boots]]. She has [[blue eyes|sky blue]] [[tareme]] eyes and [[blonde_hair|dirty blonde]]/[[brown_hair|brown]] [[drill hair]] with [[hair_between_eyes|bangs that come between her eyes]] in front and a medium-length [[ponytail]] held with a [[red_ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] and mast-themed [[hair ornament]] in back.

Her [[machinery|rigging]] includes a [[smokestack|funnel]] attached to her back with an adjoining mast and two twin-tube [[torpedo]] launchers on either side of the funnel. Further out to the sides, at thigh-level, are cutoff-ship-deck-like platforms that bear a single-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]].  She also carries a single-cannon turret in her left hand like a pistol, which is modeled like a ship's bow in her left hand.

h4. Personality

Hatakaze has a polite, elegant, humble, and mature personality type that resembles the "Yamato Nadeshiko" ideal. Her official voiced lines involve many references about looking up to her older sister-ships, such as Kamikaze, or commenting on [[asakaze (kancolle)|Asakaze's]] night-aversion or [[harukaze (kancolle)|Harukaze's]] cooking.

h4. History

The historical IJN [i]Hatakaze[/i] was launched on March 15th, 1924. At the time of the Battle of Pearl Harbor, she was assigned to Destroyer Division 5 (alongside sister-ships Harukaze, Asakaze, and Matsukaze). Destroyer Division 5 took part as escorts or screens in many of the early South Pacific invasions of the war, including the invasion of the Philippines and Solomon Islands. During the latter of which, [i]Hatakaze[/i] participated in the "Battle of Sunda Straight":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sunda_Strait], performing a torpedo attack against ABDA cruisers.

On the 2nd of March, 1943, [i]Hatakaze[/i] suffered an accidental explosion, and was forced to receive repairs for over a year, emerging in October of the following year. Following the dissolution of Destroyer Division 5, she was put directly into the Combined Fleet. On January 15th, 1945, she was sunk at port in what is now "Kaohsiung, Taiwan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaohsiung] by Allied aircraft.

h4. [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class Destroyers
* [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]] - first Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Asakaze (kancolle)|]] - second Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Harukaze (kancolle)|]] - third Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Matsukaze (kancolle)|]] - fourth Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [b]Hatakaze[/b]

h4. See also
* [[Hatakaze (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Kancolle Wiki: Hatakaze":http://en.kancollewiki.net/Hatakaze
* "Kancolle English Wikia: Hatakaze":https://kancolle.fandom.com/wiki/Hatakaze
* "Wikipedia: Japanese destroyer Hatakaze (1924)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Hatakaze_(1924)]
other_names: 旗風(艦隊これくしょん)

title: katori_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese training cruiser [i]Katori[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. 
Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

h4. Personality
She is personified around the role of a [[teacher]], carrying a [[pointer]], (or [[riding crop]] for some artists,) and prominently wearing [[glasses]]. She talks in a mature, maternal, gentle, but also somewhat flirty tone.

h4. Appearance
She has light [[brown_hair|brown]] or [[silver hair]] tied into a [[folded ponytail]] with [[parted bangs]].  She has [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[green eyes]].  She wears a [[double-breasted]] white [[jacket]] with gold [[epaulettes]] over a white [[collared shirt]] and black [[necktie]] up top combined with a gray [[skirt]]/[[pencil skirt]], and [[pantyhose]] below. Her [[machinery]] involves a backpack-like rig holding up a smokestack and two twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]s, as well as a bridge carried on a strap like a purse. Her shoes in this mode are armored [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[sandals]].

Her class was originally commissioned as training vessels as well as command vessels, especially for submarine or destroyer squadrons, but like with so much else in the Japanese arsenal, was hastily upgraded and pushed to front-line status as attrition weighed upon the IJN. This is reflected with her low maximum stats. She does have the bonus of having four slots and, as a training cruiser, an experience boost if used as a flagship in PvP.

h4. History
The historical [i]IJN Katori[/i] was named after the head Katori Shrine in Chiba Prefecture ("Katori" can translate to "Incense Acquisition"). She was sunk in "Operation Hailstone":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Hailstone] (aka The Raid on Truk Harbor to the Japanese), under the bombardment of the American battleship USS [i][[Iowa (kancolle)|]][/i] on the 17th of February, 1944. It is said that Admiral [[Raymond A. Spruance]] explicitly halted the airstrikes against her so she could be used as [b]live target practice.[/b]

h4. [i]Katori[/i]-class training cruisers
* [b]Katori[/b]
* [[Kashima (Kancolle)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Katori[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_cruiser_Katori]
other_names: 香取(艦隊これくしょん)

title: italia_(kancolle)
body:
The [[remodel (Kantai Collection)|upgraded]] form of [[Littorio (kancolle)|Littorio]] in [[Kantai Collection]].  Her name simply means "Italy".

Virtually identical in appearance, the only differences outside of stats is that her [[machinery|combat gear]] no longer has the white-and-red stripes, and she has additional secondary [[ship turret|turret]]s.  

Her summer seasonal CG is almost identical to her unremodelled portrait. She simply ditches the pareo for a towel and her mouth is open.

Her Christmas seasonal CG is also almost identical to her unremodelled portrait. She simply gave her scarf to the Roma snowman.

Historically, [i]Italia[/i] was the rename of [i]Littorio[/i] after [[Benito Mussolini]] fell from power, and [i]Littorio[/i] was captured by the Allies, as the original name had Fascist connotations.

title: destroyer_water_oni
body:
A special boss-type enemy in [[Kantai Collection]], introduced in the Fall 2015 event, centered around the "Solomon Islands Campaign":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solomon_Islands_campaign].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[pale skin]], and orangish-[[red eyes]]. She has what looks like half an [[abyssal ship]] destroyer on her head with glowing eyes worn like a hat.  Underneath the [[teeth]], she is wearing shreds of a [[black serafuku]] on top, and black [[boots]] and [[gloves]]. On her back is a hip-mounted abyssal variation of destroyer [[rigging]], with two large black arms bearing twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]].

She notably holds a blue [[tasuki]], similar to the one [[Kaga (kancolle)|Kaga]] wears.

She is likely an homage to the destroyers sunk in the "Battle of Vella Gulf":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Vella_Gulf], where four IJN destroyers, [i][[Hagikaze (kancolle)|Hagikaze]][/i], [i][[Arashi (kancolle)|Arashi]][/i], [i][[Shigure (kancolle)|Shigure]][/i], and [i][[Kawakaze (kancolle)|Kawakaze]][/i], were completely surprised by an American force of six destroyers in the middle of the night due to Americans using radar on their destroyers, while the Japanese did not (this being one of the first times the Japanese used destroyers on their own without a cruiser leader). The battle was a disastrous rout for the Japanese, with the Americans destroying all but [i]Shigure[/i] and never receiving any return fire, and afterwards, the Japanese gave up even trying to resupply their Solomon Island bases with destroyers, significantly hastening Japan's bloody retreat in the Solomon Island Campaign. 

Destroyer Water Demon may be a corrupt reflection of the merger of the three sunken destroyers, like [[Light Cruiser Oni]], or may simply be [[Hagikaze (kancolle)|Hagikaze]], alone, whose [[side ponytail]] is not easily distinguishable, considering the visible tie to [[Kaga (kancolle)|Kaga]].

title: tashkent_(warship_girls_r)
body:
A character from [[Warship Girls R]], based on the Soviet destroyer Tashkent. 

She has [[purple eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] styled into [[twintails|twin]] [[drill hair|drill]][[twindrills|s]], and wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[sailor dress]] and [[blue hat|hat]] along with [[white gloves]], a red [[armband]], [[shoes]], and [[uneven legwear|unusual]] [[white legwear]]; half [[pantyhose]] and half [[single thighhigh|stocking]].

Her rigging includes a [[ship turret|turret]] and a pair of triple-tube [[torpedo tube|torpedo launchers]].

h4.See also

title: matsukaze_(kancolle)
body:
Matsukaze (松風, lit. "Pine Wind") is fourth of the nine [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]]-class destroyers in [[Kantai Collection]]. 
Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Itou Shizuka]].

h4. Appearance

Similar to her sister-ships, she wears a [[Meiji schoolgirl uniform]] with a white [[furisode]] top along with a dark green [[hakama skirt]] tied with a sash bearing an [[anchor]] on the end, and [[knee_boots|knee-high]] [[lace-up boots]]. She has [[green eyes|green]] [[tsurime]] eyes and [[short_hair|short]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]] in front and a short cow-lick [[ahoge]] up top. She also wears a [[mini top hat]] tilted to the right side of her head.

Her [[machinery|rigging]] includes a [[smokestack|funnel]] attached to her back with an adjoining mast and two twin-tube [[torpedo]] launchers on either side of the funnel. Further out to the sides, at thigh-level, are cutoff-ship-deck-like platforms that bear a single-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]. She also carries a single-cannon turret in her left hand like a pistol, which is modeled like a ship's bow.

h4. Personality

Matsukaze has a confident, competitive, and tomboyish (and refers to herself with the boyish "boku", similar to [[hatsuzuki (kancolle)|Hatsuzuki]], among others), but also fairly warm personality. Unlike some of her sisters, she's not afraid of the night, and in her hourlies, greets them in the morning.

h4. History

The historical IJN [i]Matsukaze[/i] was launched October 30th, 1923. At the time of The Battle of Pearl Harbor, she was assigned to Destroyer Division 5 (alongside sister-ships [[Harukaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Asakaze (kancolle)|]]). As one of the more obsolete classes of destroyers, her early-war career was spent escorting troop transports for invasions, although in the Battle of Sunda Straight, she helped sink an auxiliary minesweeper.

Throughout the middle of the war (1943-1944), [i]Matsukaze[/i] was engaged in "Tokyo Express" expeditions. [i]Matsukaze[/i] was at Truk during Operation Hailstone, but survived with no direct hits from major ordinance. Later in the year, while escorting a convoy near Saipan, [i]Matsukaze[/i] was struck by a torpedo from the USS [i]Sailfish[/i] and sank on August 25th, 1944.

h4. Trivia

Her boyish character, androgynous appearance and Taisho-era clothing have drawn comparisons with "Takarazuka Revue":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takarazuka_Revue and the otokoyaku role.

h4. [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class Destroyers
* [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]]
* [[Asakaze (kancolle)|]]
* [[Harukaze (kancolle)|]]
* [[Hatakaze (kancolle)|]]
* [b]Matsukaze[/b]

h4. See also
* [[Matsukaze (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Kancolle Wiki: Matsukaze":http://en.kancollewiki.net/Matsukaze
* "Kancolle English Wikia: Matsukaze":https://kancolle.fandom.com/wiki/Matsukaze
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Matsukaze[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Matsukaze_(1923)]
other_names: 松風(艦隊これくしょん)

title: andrea_doria_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[i][[Warship Girls R]][/i]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Andrea Doria[/i]. Character designed by [[Jianren]]. 

h4. Appearance
She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] styled into [[twintails]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of set of black [[ribbon]]s with red and white dice, a [[choker]], a shoulder-less white and red top exposing her [[midriff]], [[bandaid]], a pair of brown [[gloves]], a blue [[skirt]] held in place with a leather [[belt]], [[striped legwear|striped]] [[thighhighs]] and a pair of light blue see through [[anklet]]s.

Her machinery is based on the dreadnought configuration of five [[ship turret|turret]]s of varying numbers of 12-inch [[cannon]] with her arm mounted turret representing her amidships armament.

She received a remodel (post #2019755) in patch 1.3.3 based on her historical reconstruction to a more modern battleship. This version of her is still quite physically similar to her former self, sporting a new [[sailor collar]] as part of her upper outfit, an anchor [[brooch]], the removal of her arm mounted turret, a pair of light blue see through [[bangle]]s and another two similar pieces of jewelry adorning her twin tails representing the installation of a "Pugliese Torpedo Defense System":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Littorio-class_battleship#Pugliese_torpedo_defense_system].

As part of the "Children's Day 2016":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Children%27s_Day] update an [[official alternate costume]] (post #2399989) was made available featuring a [[aged down]] version of Andrea in a [[shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], clutching a [[book]], larger hair ribbons and a bandaid in the location where her amidships turret used to be.

h4. Personality
Andrea is a thoroughbred [[tsundere]], initially disappointed with the player on acquisition, only really opening up with her remodeled version. Due to her similarities of both personalities and looks with [[Akizuki Airi]] she earned the nicknames "Airi" and "Daughter" among players and memed so hard among the community it effected the reveal and design of her sister ship [[caio duilio (warship girls r)|Caio Duilio]].

h4. See also
* [[Andrea Doria (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: [i]Andrea Doria[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_battleship_Andrea_Doria]
other_names: アンドレア・ドーリア

title: ark_royal_(kancolle)
body:
The [[Royal Navy]] aircraft carrier HMS [i]Ark Royal[/i] (pennant number 91), as depicted in [[Kantai Collection]].
Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)]], voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]].

h4. Personality
Similar to [[warspite (kancolle)|Warspite]], she has a prim and proper bearing, and mixes significant amounts of (generally well-spoken) English into her Japanese, although compared to Warspite, she has a more diligent personality, compared to Warspite's "regal bearing". Her official lines depict her having an explicit fear of torpedoes (due to her history, below), getting jumpy upon the sight of any submarine.  She also has lines explicitly mentioning [[Bismarck (kancolle)|]], whom she 'tries to get along with' in a manner like a hunter chasing prey, even launching planes after her. Such planes seems to be always [[fairey swordfish|Fairey Swordfishes]] which she is very fond of and carries around with her every time she has the chance.

h4. Appearance
Ark Royal has [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[blunt bangs]] and wears a [[tiara]]-like [[hairband]]. She has [[blue_eyes|blue]], [[tsurime]]-style eyes. She wears a white [[corset]] that forms an [[overskirt]] with a white [[jacket]] tied on with a [[red ribbon]] only covering the shoulders and [[long_sleeves|the length of the arms]], creating a [[cleavage cutout]].  On her hands, she wears brown [[fingerless gloves]].  She also wears [[white shorts]] and [[white_legwear|white]] [[pantyhose]].

Her [[machinery|rigging]] involves an overskirt-like armored shell attached at her hips, which has a ship's bridge on her back, and small twin-[[cannon]] AA [[ship turret|turrets]] at the sides.  She carries a [[quiver]] to the right of her hip, and wields a [[composite bow]] with a distinct [[flight deck]] motif in her left hand. She also wears armored [[platform footwear|platform]] [[shoes]] [[hull shoes|with a keel-like heel]].

h4. History
The historic HMS [i]Ark Royal[/i] was built under the restrictions of the Washington Naval Treaty, which significantly limited her displacement, and was the reason she was not built an armored aircraft carrier as subsequent British carriers were.  

HMS [i]Ark Royal[/i] was originally assigned to "hunter-killer" groups, focused upon hunting down and destroying German U-boats that were wreaking havoc upon Allied shipping across the Atlantic. Following the French surrender, [i]Ark Royal[/i] was part of the group that went to negotiate the surrender of the French battleships, and when the French admiralty refused, initiated attacks against the French battleships, incapacitating the [i]Dunkerque[/i], although the [i]Strasbourg[/i] escaped.  

In perhaps her most famous engagement, during May of 1941 [i]Ark Royal[/i] was instrumental in sinking the German battleship [[Bismarck (Kancolle)|]], both in finding her after British battleships lost track of her, and also when one of her Fairey Swordfish crippled the [i]Bismarck[/i], after which it was finished off by multiple Royal Navy battleships. 

[i]Ark Royal[/i] was finally sunk on 13 November 1941 from torpedoes that were launched by German submarine [[U-81 (Azur Lane)|]]. Inquiries were made regarding her sinking, as many attempts were made to save her from her fate. This inquiry concluded that design flaws due to treaty restrictions led to [i]Ark Royal[/i]'s sinking, which were rectified in later carriers built by the Royal Navy.

h4. See also
* [[Ark Royal (Azur Lane)]]
** [[Ark Royal (META) (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Ark Royal (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Ark Royal (Blue Oath)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: HMS [i]Ark Royal[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Ark_Royal_(91)]

title: johnston_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [I]Johnston[/i] (hull number DD-557), 75th of the US Navy's 175 Fletcher-class destroyers.

h4. Appearance

In comparison to [[samuel b. roberts (kancolle)|Samuel B. Roberts]], Johnston is depicted as much taller and [[medium_breasts|slightly more well-endowed]] with [[long_hair|long]] pinkish [[light brown hair]] tied into a [[two side up]] style and [[brown eyes]].

She wears a stylized [[serafuku]] which consists of an [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[blue shirt]] with a black [[sailor collar]] that exposes her [[cleavage]] and short [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], along with [[black thighhighs]] held by [[garter straps]] with what seem to be metallic thigh and [[shin guards]] and red [[rudder footwear|rudder shoes]]. Johnston's damaged CG has her stripped of some of her clothing, revealing a bit of her black underwear.

On her left hand she wears a [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]], an oblique reference to the injuries to the left hand sustained by her captain, "Lieutenant Commander Ernest E. Evans":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_E._Evans], including losing two fingers. Draped on her left upper arm is the [[united states medal of honor|Medal of Honor]], presumably similar to the one posthumously awarded to Lieutenant Commander Evans for his actions in the "Battle off Samar":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_off_Samar].

Her [[machinery]] consists of two [[smokestack]]s and two 5-inch [[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]s with one set on each side of her rigging, with a third [[adapted turret|handheld turret]] on her right hand. Her hull number is emblazoned on each side of her lower rigs.

h4. Personality

She is often compared to [[amatsukaze (kancolle)|Amatsukaze]] due to both having similar [[two side up]] hairstyles and sailor outfits with gartered thighhighs as well as apparently sharing similar [[tsundere]] personalities.

h4. History

The historical destroyer was part of the Taffy 3 party (which included [[samuel b. Roberts (kancolle)|Samuel B. Roberts]] and [[gambier bay (kancolle)|Gambier Bay]]) and was sunk during the "Battle off Samar":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_off_Samar] by successive firings from Kurita Takeo's forces, but not before scoring hits of her own, including those to [[kumano (kancolle)|Kumano]]. For her actions, she was given a Presidential Unit Citation and six battle stars, which shipgirl Johnston displays as one bronze star and one silver star (equivalent to five bronzes) on her collar.

h4. Trivia

She's voiced by "Shiraki Nao":https://myanimelist.net/people/42439 and was designed by [[Zeco]]. Her namesake is "Navy Lieutenant John V. Johnston":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_V._Johnston], who fought for the Union from 1862 to 1864 during the American Civil War. She is the game's first bona fide American destroyer, despite the fact that destroyer escort [[samuel b. roberts (kancolle)|Samuel B. Roberts]] was already classified as a destroyer in the game.

h4. See also

* [[Johnston (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: USS Johnston (DD-557)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Johnston_(DD-557)]
* "Wikipedia: Fletcher-class destroyer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fletcher-class_destroyer]
* "Wikipedia: John V. Johnston":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_V._Johnston]
other_names: ジョンストン(艦隊これくしょん)

title: arashio_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body: With her second remodel released in the 25th January 2017 update, she wears the uniform shared by the rest of the remodeled Asashio-class. Arashio's version consists of a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] under a [[frilled_dress|frilled]] [[pinafore dress]] and [[black pantyhose]]. Her equipment consists of a hand-held [[ship turret|turret]], two [[torpedo|torpedo launchers]] [[thigh_strap|strapped]] to her thighs, a [[searchlight]] resembling a [[crime prevention buzzer]] and a [[daihatsu_(landing_craft)|daihatsu]] attached to her backpack straps.

title: hood_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[[Warship Girls R]] character.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a small [[ahoge]] and a vibrant pink flower shaped [[hair ornament]]. She also wears a pair of [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] [[glasses]]. Her outfit consists of a military themed officer's outfit in black with white cuffs, a white [[capelet]] all with gold trim, prominent [[aiguillette]], a blue [[plaid skirt]] and white [[thighhighs]].

Her machinery is equally split between both sides of her, mounting two superfiring [[ship turret|turret]]s of twin 15-inch [[cannon]] to her left and right representing her forward and stern main armament configuration. Her ship funnels and a mast flying the [[white ensign]] are mounted behind her.

On August 29th, Hood's remodeled artwork (post #2401044) was revealed as part of the Project R trailer and her remodel was released with patch 2.0 in early November. This version of Hood's hair ornament changes color to purple, her military uniform's base colors change to white with blue cuffs and capelet. Her footwear now features a blue cross shaped pattern with a [[union jack]] on her right leg. 

The machinery is also updated to include two red and white armor plates mounted forward to protect her legs and thighs, the addition of a pair of twin 4-inch turrets and a pair of British 2 Pounder 8 Barrel "Pom-Pom" anti-air guns mounted to her rear. The mast is replaced with the ship's spotting top featuring type 284 gunnery radar.

Hood is depicted as a well-spoken, serene woman, exemplifying true British values such as sipping tea, staying calm and carrying on. Her bad eyesight is accredited to HMS Hood's inability to discern the difference between Prinz Eugene and Bismarck during the opening phases of the Battle of Denmark Strait. She may be suffering a degree of breast envy, padding out her chest area with one of the ship's cats, Fishcakes.

A bug with her remodel's [[chibi]] battle sprite where she would be stuck in a permanent [[@_@]] state after taking damage of any kind has associated her with the facial expression.

She is regularly paired with [[bismarck (warship girls r)|Bismarck]] either as bitter rivals, in some form of [[Yuri]] situation or both at the same time. She may also be seen as the leader of other Royal Navy characters due to her remodel's skill requiring that she be made flagship of any formation to take effect.

She is based on the British Royal Navy's "HMS Hood":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Hood], an Admiral-Class warship named after "Admiral Samuel Hood":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_Hood,_1st_Viscount_Hood]. Her ship index number is 1.

Her original artist was [[JS Sang]] but with her remodel her art was replaced with [[15k]].

h4. See also

* [[Hood (Azur Lane)]]

title: rodney_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[[Warship Girls R]] character.

Rodney has [[blonde hair|blonde]] low-tied hair with the tail end resting on or just [[hair over shoulder|over her right shoulder]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit is a late 18th/early 19th century inspired [[military uniform|Royal Navy officer's uniform]] made of up of a black [[bicorne]] [[hat]] with golden trim, an embroidered blue coat with red facings, cuffs, collar, golden [[epaulettes]], [[aiguillette]], a pair of white [[gloves]], a red [[sash]] worn around the waist, a white [[skirt]] and white [[thighhighs|thighigh]] boots.

A large portion of her machinery is located on her right side with all three of her triple 16-inch gun [[ship turret|turrets]] representing the design of the Nelson-class where all main armaments were located forward of the super structure. On her left a large curved shield in the shape of a ship's stern is used as protection. There are several additional turrets of double 6-inch guns located on the inner ring of the machinery as a secondary armament with a mast and crane in the back. 

Rodney received a remodel early in the game's life. This version of Rodney sees her entire outfit swap colors with red replacing blue and blue replacing red. The plumage on her bicorne increases with new white plumage mixed into the fray. There's an additional white sash draping down from her left shoulder with golden trim added to almost all pieces of clothing. White [[garter straps]] are also made visible.

The machinery is augmented with a green and blue camouflage paint scheme. The main turrets and the rear section of the machinery mounts multiple single 20mm Oerlikon cannons and a single 2 Pounder 8 Barrel "Pom-Pom" anti-air gun. On one turret a Supermarine Walrus rests on a seaplane catapult. The inner ring of equipment is removed with three of the four 6-inch turrets now located on the more ship like designed stern, better representing how these secondary batteries were positioned. The mast has also been replaced with a smokestack and the ship's conning tower with various gunnery and aircraft detecting radar.

On Children's Day 2015 a child version of unmodified Rodney was awarded as a quest reward, with lighter colored machinery covered in crayon graffiti. 

A kind individual concerned with the success of her sister and a lover of a nice Atlantic Sea breeze. A combination of her pleasant remodel art and her powerful armor piercing BIG SEVEN special attacks have made her one of the most ringed ships in the game.

Her [[chibi]] battle sprite was one of the first to be revealed as a combatant in the Project R trailer .

In April 2016 Rodney was likened to English teacher [[Ellen Baker]] due to their almost identical looks and their English speaking backgrounds, with [[15k]] posting an image of Rodney swinging one of her main turrets like a baseball bat.

She is based on the British Royal Navy's "HMS Rodney":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Rodney_(29)] a Nelson-class inter-war warship named after "Admiral George Brydges Rodney":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Brydges_Rodney,_1st_Baron_Rodney]. Armed with 16-inch [[cannon|main guns]] she was one of the [i]Big Seven[/i] warships. Her ship index number is 9.

Her official artist is [[15k]].

title: kashima_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese training cruiser [i]Kashima[/i].  She was named after the [[Shinto]] shrine Kashima Jingu, but her name literally means "deer island".
Character design by [[Parsley-F]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

h4. Personality
Perhaps even more than Katori, she has a highly feminine personality. Her verbal habit is to end most of her lines in "ufufu", which is usually seen as a coquettish laugh. Several of her in-game lines also paint her as someone who wistfully longs for peace, a reference to both the fact that she, as a training vessel, isn't much of a warrior and lacks any confidence in her combat ability, and the fact that the historic ship was commissioned during the peace before the war, engaged in essentially no combat the whole duration of the war, and was used as a repatriation vessel after the war before being scrapped in Japan. (Personality-wise, this makes her similar to [[inazuma (kancolle)|Inazuma]].)  Her in-game lines portray her as lacking in self-confidence and happiest when cooking or brewing coffee for others. Unlike Katori, she's generally shown as a gentle girl who shows her admiral kindness if not affection, making her particularly popular. This has sometimes resulted in a particularly lustful/lewd image, partially from all the doujins she's recieved as as result of her popularity.

h4. Appearance
Kashima has [[blue eyes|bluish]]-[[grey eyes]] with a [[tsurime]] style, and [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[grey hair]] tied into [[twintails]], with [[sidelocks]] in the front. She also has [[large breasts]].

Similar to her sister-ship, she wears a [[white jacket|white]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[double-breasted]] [[military jacket]] with black [[buttons]] and trim, along with gold [[epaulettes]] and a [[red neckerchief]].  She wears [[white gloves]], has a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] charcoal/[[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and sandal-like shoes.  She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]] with two flag-like flaps of cloth accentuating it. These flags appear to be the signal flags Uniform and Yankee. When flown together these mean "I am carrying out exercises. Please keep clear of me", referring to Kashima's status as a training cruiser. When damaged, it appears she wears [[no bra]] and [[no panties]].

Kashima's [[machinery|combat gear]] involves a large pair of [[binoculars]], her depth charge launcher carried like a briefcase, her bridge carried on a strap like a purse, and a back-mounted weapons platform with twin [[searchlight|searchlights]], and a large and small pair of twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turrets]].

For Christmas 2015, she was given a red knit sweater with fur trimming, a Christmas [[capelet]] and a Christmassy version of her hat. She is seen holding a popper.

For a campaign with [i][[Lawson]][/i] in February 2016, she was designated, along with Katori, to wear the Lawson uniform.

h4. History
Historically, the IJN [i]Kashima[/i] was designated for front-line duty, leading landings or being a flagship for fleet action, during the earlier parts of the war, but never actually saw combat, before being sent back to resume its intended role as a training ship.  As a training ship, she was notably a much slower ship, and not as particularly well-armed as most other light cruisers. During the last year of the war, however, the desperate Japanese pressed her into service as a transport and as an anti-submarine patrol ship.  During this time, she collided with and sank a transport ship, [i]Daishin Maru[/i], marking the only kill of her career. She survived the war, was used as a repatriation vessel, and was kept by the Japanese, eventually being broken up for scrap.

h4. [i]Katori[/i]-class training cruisers
* [[Katori (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Kashima[/b]

h4. See also
* pool #10993: "Kashima is a Good Girl" - Whenever she shows her innocent side, explains she isn't a lewd girl or feels bad about her lustful image.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Kashima[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_cruiser_Kashima]
other_names: 鹿島(艦隊これくしょん)

title: de_ruyter_(kancolle)
body:
A [[Kantai Collection]] character based on HNLMS De Ruyter, which was a unique light cruiser of the Royal Netherlands Navy. She is one of many ships named after Dutch naval hero Admiral "Michiel Adriaenszoon de Ruyter":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michiel_de_Ruyter. She is the first ever Dutch shipgirl as well as the first ever shipgirl for her artist [[Sara (kadokawa)|]].

De Ruyter has [[long hair|long]] [[curly hair|curly]] brownish [[red hair]] with a [[side braid]] and [[blunt bangs]], and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[brown shirt|beige]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[green sailor collar]], an [[orange neckerchief]] and [[chain]]s held by a golden [[bell]], and a [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]] as well as a [[black belt]] with more chains and [[anchor]]s, short [[black thighhighs|black]] [[over-kneehighs|over-knee socks]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[high_heels|high-heeled]] [[shoes]]. Her [[machinery]] includes six of her seven 150-mm guns ([[adapted turret|she holds the seventh in her hand]]), her tall forward superstructure, a [[smokestack]], and several smaller [[ship turret|turret]]s. She also wears a [[black hairband]] with midships aircraft catapult attached to it.

Because her artist is an in-house illustrator, she got her first seasonal CG almost three weeks after she was introduced into the game through the 2019 Autumn event while said event was still ongoing. This seasonal CG, a Christmas-themed one, shows her wearing a [[red dress]] with a [[corset]], a [[white skirt|white]] pleated skirt, a [[white capelet]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[holly hair ornament]], black thighhighs, and [[fur-trimmed_boots|fur-trimmed]] [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She also has a [[Setsubun]] CG where she wears a [[red coat|red]] [[plaid coat]], a [[brown sweater]], a [[black skirt|black]] pleated skirt, an [[orange scarf]], black thighhighs, and black [[fur-trimmed boots]].

She comes off as a preppy girl who has a penchant for using the expression "Yabai" in both good and bad contexts.

The historical De Ruyter was laid down on 16 September 1933 at the Wilton-Fijenoord dockyard in Schiedam and commissioned on 3 October 1936. She was sunk in the Battle of the Java Sea in 1942.

h4. See Also
* [[list of Kantai Collection characters]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: HNLMS De Ruyter (1935)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HNLMS_De_Ruyter_(1935)]
other_names: デ・ロイテル(艦隊これくしょん)
デロイテル(艦隊これくしょん)

title: graf_zeppelin_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]] personification of the German aircraft carrier [i]Graf Zeppelin[/i].
Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Hayami Saori]].

h4. Personality
Graf Zeppelin has a confident, militaristic, blunt, and stoic manner of speech. Her [[official art|(official) art]] style has her looking quite cold and nearly monochrome, most likely to reflect on her historic counterpart's noncompletion. She is frequently seen in the company of the other German ships, especially [[bismarck (kancolle)|Bismarck]] and [[prinz eugen (kancolle)|Prinz Eugen]], and occasionally as having a senpai-kouhai relationship with [[Akagi (kancolle)|Akagi]], from whom some of her flight deck design was copied. As her hourlies implies, she's an avid coffee drinker, making coffee up to four times between 10 pm to 7 am.

h4. Appearance
She has [[grey eyes]] in [[tsurime]] style. She has [[blonde hair]] with notable [[sidelocks]] and [[twintails]], as well as [[hair between eyes|hair dangling between her eyes]].

She wears a white [[jacket]] that is unmistakably [[impossible_clothes|impossibly tight]] on her [[large breasts]] and even shows her navel. She also wears a [[capelet]] with red trim, a black-and-red [[necktie]] bearing a black (iron) [[cross]], a black [[miniskirt]], [[black pantyhose]], black [[gloves]] and a [[peaked cap]].

Her [[machinery|combat gear]] involves a split-hull design similar to KanColle battleships like [[Nagato (kancolle)|Nagato]]. Unlike Japanese carriers, she carries no historical weapon representing aircraft launching, instead holding a small deck of two twin-[[cannon]] anti-air [[ship turret|turrets]] like a pistol. Her hull also has twin-cannon turrets. Her carrier deck is carried on a robotic swing arm from the back of the hull that is attached to her back on a metal girdle.

h4. History
The historic Graf Zeppelin was also notable for incorporating design flaws the other major powers had already learned to avoid. Graf Zeppelin's surface armament was 16 single-purpose 15 cm guns in 8 twin-mount casemates, at a time when other countries were arming their carriers with smaller dual-purpose guns to increase their anti-air coverage. These guns were of heavy cruiser size, numbered more than a heavy cruiser would carry for "commerce raiding operations" and would have required the carrier to come into direct surface engagement range to actually use. This was in fact the result of miscommunication with the ship's designer, who intended to save weight by using 4 twin-mount instead of 8 single-mount casemates; the builders thought that he was instead telling them to double the total number of guns. In game, though, this trait is the reason she's able to attack during night battles, the first night carrier in the game (though not night airstrike combat-capable).

title: nelson_(warship_girls_r)
body:
A battleship class character in [[Warship Girls R]].

Nelson has [[orange hair|orange]] sometimes bordering [[red hair|red]] hair pulled back into a [[long hair|long]] low [[ponytail]] which can often be missed and [[blue eyes]]. A mole sits just beneath her [[mole under eye|right eye]] which she keeps [[one eye closed|closed]] at all times. Her outfit is based on Horatio Nelson's admiral [[military uniform|uniform]]. An embroidered black coat with golden [[epaulettes]] and trim sits atop a white frilled undershirt with her right sleeve rolled up to the elbow. White [[gloves]], a red [[skirt]] and a pair of black [[thighhighs|thighhigh]] boots finish the outfit off. She's also personally armed with a Royal Navy officers' sword with a black grip and golden hilt. Her closed eye and rolled up sleeve are a reference to the permanent wounds suffered by Admiral Nelson.

A large portion of her machinery is located on her right side with all three of her triple 16-inch gun [[ship turret|turrets]] representing the design of the Nelson-class where all main armaments were located forward of the super structure. On her left a large curved shield in the shape of a ship's stern is used as protection. There are several additional turrets of double 6-inch guns located on the inner ring of the machinery as a secondary armament with a mast in the back. 

She received a remodel (post #2244658) early in the game's life. Nelson's uniform mostly remains the same but with added [[medal|medals]], a red and blue [[sash]] draping down from her right shoulder, black [[garter straps]] attached to her boots and she clutches onto a golden [[pocket watch]].

The machinery is painted in green and blue camouflage. Two of her main turrets and the rear section of the machinery mounts an excessive number of single 20mm Oerlikon cannons and the central turret plays host to a 2 Pounder 8 Barrel "Pom-Pom" anti-air gun. The inner ring of equipment is removed with three of the four 6-inch turrets now located on the more ship like designed stern, better representing how these secondary batteries were positioned. The mast has also been replaced with a smokestack and the ship's conning tower with various gunnery and aircraft detecting radar.

A woman whose devotion to duty drives her to greater achievements she also endeavors to inspire those around her, [i]England expects that every man do his duty[/i] after all.

She is based on the lead ship of the British Royal Navy's Nelson-class inter-war warship "HMS Nelson":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Nelson_(28)] named after "Vice Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horatio_Nelson,_1st_Viscount_Nelson]. Armed with 16-inch [[cannon|main guns]], she was one of the [i]Big Seven[/i] warships. Her ship index number is 8.

Her official artist is [[15k]].

title: ancient_destroyer_oni
body:
[[abyssal ship|Abyssal]] boss in the game [[Kantai Collection]]. First appeared during the 2016 Fall Event.

Like many Abyssals, she has [[pale skin]], and [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[blue eyes|eyes]]. There is a [[mole under eye|mole]] under her left eye. Her hair is [[short hair|short]] (or bound-up), [[black hair|black]] (with a white [[streaked hair|streak]]), and styled in the [[side_drill|very uncommon]] [[side ponytail|side]][[drill hair|-drill]]. Additionally, there is an [[anchor hair ornament]] on the end of a [[single sidelock]].

Her clothing is all blacks and greys. She is dressed in a [[meiji schoolgirl uniform]] that consists of a grey [[kimono]], black [[hakama skirt]] & [[obi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[boots]]. She also appears to wear [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[gloves]]. 

She is armed with a monstrous Abyssal [[cannon|gun]] [[ship turret|turret]], replete with one-and-a-half horrific, [[teeth|toothy]] maws, bristling with gun barrels, disturbingly organic-looking [[mechabare]], and a [[hose]] dangling from the bottom.

While it is [i]very[/i] easy to mistake her for [[Ancient Destroyer Princess]], there are some key differences:
* Oni looks far more intact and composed, while Princess looks significantly more damaged.
* Oni's Abyssal turret gun is one mouth grafted to another top set of teeth and a broken, incomplete jaw, while Princess's turret looks more completed: it has merged and integrated the two upper sets of teeth into one, centralized the lower jaw, and fixed up the machinery parts inside.
* Oni's hair is either shorter or pinned up, while Princess's is much longer and/or hanging down freely.
* Oni's side-drill is shorter.
* Oni lacks the white tasuki that Princess wears.

h4. See also

* [[kamikaze (kancolle)|]]
* [[battleship princess]]

title: ancient_destroyer_princess
body:
[[abyssal ship|Abyssal]] boss in the game [[Kantai Collection]]. First appeared during the 2016 Fall Event. Extremely similar in appearance to [[Ancient Destroyer Oni]].

She has [[pale skin]] and [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[blue eyes|eyes]]--features common to most Abyssals--and a [[mole under eye|mole]] under her left eye. Her hair is [[long hair|long]], [[black hair|black]] (with a white [[streaked hair|streak]]), and styled in the [[side_drill|very uncommon]] [[side ponytail|side]][[drill hair|-drill]]. Additionally, there is an [[anchor hair ornament]] on the end of one of her unevenly-long[[sidelocks]].

Her black and grey clothing is noticeably [[torn clothes|shredded and torn]], apparently due to taking damage. She is dressed in a [[meiji schoolgirl uniform]] that consists of a grey [[kimono]], black [[hakama skirt]] & [[obi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[thigh boots|thigh]] [[boots]]. She also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[gloves]] on her arms, and a white [[tasuki]] on her right shoulder.

Her gun is strangely much more put-together than she is: a monstrous Abyssal [[cannon|gun]] [[ship turret|turret]] mounted atop a mouth-and-a-half filled with [[teeth]], jaws, gun barrels, glowing [[energy]], and disturbingly organic-looking [[mechabare]]. The [[hose]] dangling from the bottom has detached and hangs loose.

While she is quite easily mistaken for [[Ancient Destroyer Oni]], there are some key differences:
* Princess looks like she's been through the wringer, as opposed to Oni, who seems quite undamaged.
* Princess's Abyssal gun turret looks more completed and properly built than Oni's; the two upper sets of teeth ahve been fixed and set neatly together, while the lower jaw sits in the center between them; the internal parts exposed by the open mouth look more deliberate and less haphazard.
* Princess's much longer hair hangs down in the back, while Oni's hair is either shorter or pinned up.
* Princess has a longer side-drill.
* Princess has a white tasuki on her right shoulder, while Oni does not.

h4. See also

* [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]]
* [[Battleship Princess]]

title: deutschland_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the German pocket battleship/heavy cruiser [i]Deutschland[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Ran (Bukeranwu)]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[black hair]] with a red highlight in her bangs and a white highlight in her left sidelock. She has bright [[blue eyes]]. On her head is a [[black headwear|black]] [[peaked cap]] with a band of cloth fake teeth and [[goggles on headwear|goggles on it]]. She wears a [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]] and a black [[long coat]] with red lining over it. On her left arm, she has a red [[armband]] with an [[iron cross]]. She wears [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]] with red soles and a noticeable heel. She has red armored/mechanical gloves.

Her [[rigging]] is a twin-hull design with two mechanical jaws for hulls. She has two triple-barreled [[ship turret|turrets]] attached to the side of each hull, and smaller secondary turrets atop them. She carries a handheld [[gun]] colored black and red, with a fake-tooth grin near the muzzle.

title: massachusetts_(azur_lane)
body:
Third ship of the US Navy's [i]South Dakota[/i]-class battleships, USS [i]Massachusetts[/i] (BB-59), in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Enka (bcat)|]], voiced by [[Takahashi Rie]].

She has [[multicolored hair]] being mostly white on the outside, while green-cyan or black on the inside. She has [[dark skin]] and several [[body markings]] near her collarbone and on her abdomen. Her outfit consists of a black and white [[bikini top only|bikini top]] where the straps are attached to a [[choker]] with a Native American-esque design, a pair of black [[short shorts]] and an [[open_jacket|open]], [[black jacket]] that hangs [[off_shoulder|off her shoulders]]. In addition, she wears [[camouflage_footwear|camo-patterned]] [[combat boots]]. Her hairstyle and dark complexion leads many players to note similarities to [[Altera (Fate)|]].

Her [[rigging]] features three triple-barreled [[ship turret|turrets]], two of which are suspended at her sides, while the third is attached to the back rigging. A small section of hull plating is suspended from the turrets as well as smaller secondary turrets. Her back rigging is her superstructure and conning tower, featuring a [[radar dish]].

In real life, [i]Massachusetts[/i] was the only one of the class to have initially seen frontline service in the Atlantic/Mediterranean theaters, bombarding Casablanca in November 1942 (leading to her gunnery exchange with [[Jean Bart (Azur Lane)|]], in anchor at that time). She was only transferred to the Pacific in early 1943 to replace her sister South Dakota (then headed stateside for repairs), seeing action escorting the carrier forces.

Post-war, she was decommissioned in 1947, but it took until 1965 for her to become a museum ship.

title: colorado_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Colorado[/i] (BB-45). 
Character design by [[Parsley-F]].

h4. Appearance

Like [[iowa (kancolle)|Iowa]] before her, she is given traits, based upon some old WWII-era US Navy pin-ups such as: [[short_hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[side braids]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[large_breasts|well endowed]] yet petite body. She wears a [[grey headwear|grey]] [[garrison cap]], yardarm [[headgear]] that is already typical for the Big 7, a two-part [[grey dress|gray]] [[pleated dress]] with blue accents and a [[sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] that [[sideboob|exposes one side of each breast]], a [[blue necktie]] with the number 45 on it, [[black gloves|black]] and grey [[elbow gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], a grey [[capelet]] with blue underside, and red [[high_heels|high-heeled shoes]].

Her machinery includes her famed 16-inch guns (four at each side in twin [[ship turret|turrets]]), a [[smokestack]] and a [[lattice mast]] with a large clock face among others. She is given a [[remodel_(kantai_collection)|remodel]] which trades the clock face for a radar antenna atop the mast, paints her wooden deck grey and modernizes her secondary and anti-aircraft guns.

h4. History

The historical USS [i]Colorado[/i] saw a long and active career that took her into both Atlantic and Pacific oceans. She participated in a number of fleet exercises in the inter-war years, and also briefly served in various tasks such as becoming a training ship, and even assisting in the search for Amelia Earhart. During WWII, [i]Colorado[/i] saw extensive action throughout the Pacific against the Japanese, being a constant presence in pre-invasion shelling and fire support actions from Tarawa all the way to Okinawa. For her service, the battleship was awarded seven battle stars. After the war, she participated in "Operation Magic Carpet" to bring US troops back home. She was decommissioned in 1947 and sold for scrap in 1959.

h4. Trivia

She is named after the state of Colorado, the second such ship in the US Navy but the third to carry the name (the first USS [i]Colorado[/i], a steam screw frigate, was named after the Colorado River).

She is the first foreign shipgirl as well as the first personified battleship for her artist [[Parsley-f]]. She is also the fourth (second foreign) member of the so-called Big 7 (the seven battleships with 16-inch guns built before WWII) in the game, joining [[nagato (kancolle)|Nagato]], [[mutsu (kancolle)|Mutsu]], and [[nelson (kancolle)|Nelson]].

In comparison to the other Big 7 in the game, she is given a petite body and a more youthful appearance, reflecting the fact the Colorado-class battleships were the shortest of the Big 7 at 624 feet 3 inches (190.27 m) each, compared to the Nagato-class at 708 feet (215.8 m; later lengthened to 738 feet/224.94 m) each and the Nelson-class at 710 feet (216.4 m) each. In spite of this shorter length, their displacement was equal to that of her counterparts, at 32,600 long tons unloaded (compare the Nagato-class at 32,200 long tons and the Nelson-class at 33,300 long tons), which is reflected by her curvaceous figure and ample bosom.

h4. [i]Colorado[/i]-class battleships

title: fletcher_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of "USS [i]Fletcher[/i] (hull number DD-445)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Fletcher_(DD-445)], nameship of the US Navy's 175 Fletcher-class destroyers. Her namesake (and namesake of the class) is Navy Admiral "Frank Friday Fletcher (1855-1928)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Friday_Fletcher], who served in the 19th and 20th centuries, most notably as commander of naval forces at the "Battle of Veracruz":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_occupation_of_Veracruz] in Mexico. She is designed by [[Zeco]], who also illustrated the first of her class in the game, [[johnston (kancolle)|Johnston]].

The Fletcher class was the most numerous of the destroyers that participated in World War II, built completely free from any treaty restrictions with a larger size, larger fuel capacity and range, and better armaments. In the world of Kantai Collection, this translates to Fletcher and Johnston being tall and having ample bustlines; among the other non-Japanese destroyers before them, only [[tashkent (kancolle)|Tashkent]] is comparable in those areas while the others are implied to have flat chests.

Being the nameship of the class, Fletcher herself is given traits of [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with triangular [[double_bun|side buns]], [[purple eyes]], and a [[large_breasts|very well-endowed]] body. Her outfit is similar to Johnston's but with the black features being given lighter colors: a stylized [[serafuku]] which consists of an [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[blue shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]] that exposes her [[cleavage]], a [[yellow neckerchief]], and a short [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], along with [[white legwear|white]] [[thighhighs]] that are shielded by what seem to be metallic thigh and [[shin guards]] and red [[rudder footwear|rudder shoes]]. She also wears [[white gloves|white short gloves]] and a metallic [[hairband]]. In her [[remodel (kantai_collection)|remodeled form]], she adds a [[star hair ornament]] to each side of her hairband.

Her [[machinery]] consists of two [[smokestack]]s and two 5-inch [[cannon]] [[ship turret]]s with one set on each side of her rigging. Her hull number is emblazoned on each side of her lower rigs. She also carries a [[cargo net]], a reference to her rescuing many survivors of the USS [i][[Northampton_(kancolle)|]][/i] during the "Battle of Tassafaronga":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Tassafaronga] by using cork-floated cargo nets.

For her remodels see the respective tags:
* [[Fletcher Kai (kancolle)|]]
* [[Fletcher Mk II (kancolle)|]]


In one of her lines, she refers to herself as "Lucky 13," a historical nickname developed by the historal crew. This stems from the great luck they received despite multiple instances of the number. She survived the events of November 13, 1942 (a Friday to boot) during the "Naval Battle of Guadalcanal":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_Battle_of_Guadalcanal] unharmed while being the 13th out of a line of 13 ships, with three torpedoes missing her hull. The digits of her hull number add up to 13; the same can be said of Task Force 67, of which she was a member.

Fletcher is one of the US Navy's most decorated ships during World War II, earning 15 battle stars for her service in the Pacific. She would later earn another five battle stars for service in the Korean War. Fletcher was decommissioned twice, first in 1947 before being reactivated in 1949 and then again in 1969, ending up being scrapped the same year.

Of her 174 class sisters, 19 (including Johnston) were lost in battle, six were heavily damaged and never repaired, and the rest had varying degrees of success in World War II and beyond with several being transferred to other navies (including 11 to the modern Italian Navy, the West German Bundesmarine, and the [[japan_maritime_self-defense_force|JMSDF]]). Four still survive to this day as museum ships (The Sullivans, Charrette/Velos, Kidd, and Cassin Young) with a fifth (John Rodgers/Cuitláhuac) serving until 2001 before being scrapped in 2006.
