title: bowser
body:
The King of the Koopas, and [[mario|Mario]]'s arch-nemesis. He frequently kidnaps [[Princess Peach]] and terrorizes the Mushroom Kingdom.

[[Bowser Jr.]] is his son. The Koopalings, [[iggy koopa|Iggy]], [[larry koopa|Larry]], [[lemmy koopa|Lemmy]], [[ludwig von koopa|Ludwig]], [[morton koopa jr.|Morton]], [[roy koopa|Roy]], and [[wendy o. koopa|Wendy]], were formerly considered to be his children as well, but this has been "officially retconned by Miyamoto Shigeru since 2012.":https://web.archive.org/web/20180504092230/http://www.gameinformer.com:80/b/features/archive/2012/09/24/miyamoto-tezuka-interview.aspx

Japanese name: [b]Koopa[/b]

title: drake_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

She is a member of [[Matis (Nikke)|]] along with [[laplace (nikke)|Laplace]] and [[maxwell (nikke)|Maxwell]], Drake often presents herself as a villain among the three, however this often puts her in unfortunate situations such as inadvertently doing good deeds. Aside from her villain-like motif, Drake is often presented as a naive and airheaded Nikke, much to [[Maxwell (nikke)|]]'s dismay.

Like other members of Matis, Drake is named after a famous scientist, namely the late astronomer [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Drake](Frank Drake), who is known for the Drake equation.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] which has a [[hairclip]] attached on it. She has [[small breasts]]. She wears [[earrings]] She wears a [[black leotard]] clad in [[armor|red armor]], [[armored glove]], and [[armored boots]], usually seen with a [[off shoulder]] [[red cape]]. During combat, Drake conjures a [[headgear]]//[[mask]]. Her usual demeanor shows her [[grin|grinning]] or [[evil grin|evil grinning]].

Illustrator: Unknown (default and Maid for Villain), [[Dramz|D.ramz]] (Villain Racer)

title: reference_photo
body:
A [[photo (medium)|]] that has been used as a reference by an artist when creating an art piece. The result of using such references can range from detailed recreations of the photographs to simple copied poses, expressions, or situations.

[b]This tag is for the photos themselves[/b], not for images based on reference photos. Use when the post is wholly the reference material. If the reference photo is displayed alongside the referencing photo, use [[reference inset]] and [[photo inset]] instead.

Not to be confused with photos used in [[photo background]]s, which are not used as referenced to create the actual art piece.

h4. Example

* !asset #20076336: [b][[Reference photo]][/b]
* !post #7315357: [[Photo-referenced]]

h4. See also

* [[reference inset]]
* [[photo (medium)|]]
* [[photo inset]]
* [[photo-referenced]]

title: photo-referenced
body:
An image that was inspired from a [[photo (medium)|]], or otherwise based on photographic source material, including video.

Artists will sometimes indicate that they are replicating a photograph (写真模写) or even outright tracing one (写真トレス) in their description or tags.

The referenced photo is sometimes displayed as a [[photo inset]].

h4. Example

* !asset #20076336: [[Reference photo]]
* !post #7315357: [b][[Photo-referenced]][/b]

h4. See also

* [[derivative work]]
* [[photo background]]
* [[reference inset]]
* [[reference photo]]
* [[rotoscoping]]

Like all members of Inherit, Noah is named after the "Biblical figure of the same name":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noah].

She carries a [[floating object|floating]] [[shield]], wears an [[armored bodysuit|armored]] [[black bodysuit]], large parts of her body are armored including [[armored boots]], [[armored gloves]], a [[breastplate]], [[pauldrons]], [[leg armor]], [[hip armor]] and a [[sparkle hair ornament]].

title: marian_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a former member of Silver Gun.

The first Nikke which the [[Commander (nikke)|]] encounters. Despite being the first playable Nikke in the game's tutorial, she is not unlockable as a playable character.

She has [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]]. She wears a [[blue headwear|white]] [[garrison cap]], [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]], [[collared shirt|collared]] [[sleeveless shirt]], [[black pantyhose]], [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], [[blue necktie]], [[brown belt]], and [[black footwear]]. 

[spoiler]After Marian is corrupted by the Raptures, the Commander has to euthanize her, with her last words thanking them for a bandage. It is later revealed that [[Modernia (Nikke)|]] is her new reincarnation.[/spoiler]

The [[commander (nikke)|]] would later discover that Enikk and Chatterbox had made a deal: the Raptures would not attack the Ark in exchange for a regular sacrifice of Nikkes to be used as servants for the Rapture Queen, [spoiler]with Marian being the latest and last Nikke to be offered.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Do not use this tag with [[Modernia (nikke)|]] unless both forms are present, as Modernia is specifically for Marian's new form.[/spoiler]

Illustrator: [[KKUEM]]

title: tail
body:
A long appendage protruding from the lower back. Often covered in fur or scales. A common feature of animal girls.

In general, don't tag this on an [[animal]] unless there's something special or noteworthy about the tail, such as one of the many tags below that implicate this tag like [[heart tail]] or [[holding with tail]], or if the image is focused on the tail. Definitely don't tag an animal with a tail of its own type, like tagging [[cat tail]] on a [[cat]]. (Do tag weird combos like a [[rabbit tail]] on a [[cat]], though.)

h4. See also

* [[kemonomimi mode]]
* [[tail through clothes]]
* [[Tag group:Tail]]

body:
A highly trained variant of the [[stormtrooper]] in [[Star Wars]]. Shadow Troopers utilize experimental cloaking armor, distinguished by it's all-black coloration with an imperial insignia over the left chest.

Shadow Troopers primarily appear in Star Wars Legends video games and supplemental material, with their only post-Disney canon appearance being in DICE's 2015 Battlefront game. The [[Deathtrooper]]s introduced in [[rogue one: a star wars story|Rogue One]] have since been a semi-replacement for Shadow Troopers in the new canon.

title: star_wars:_the_clone_wars_(movie)
body:
Star Wars: The Clone Wars is a 2008 American animated space opera film directed by Dave Filoni, produced by Lucasfilm Ltd. and Lucasfilm Animation, and distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures, becoming the first [[Star Wars]] film to not be distributed by [[20th century studios|20th Century Fox]]. It is the first fully animated film in the Star Wars franchise and takes place shortly after [[star wars: attack of the clones|Episode II – Attack of the Clones]] (2002), at the start of the titular Clone Wars. In the film, [[Count Dooku]] and Jabba the Hutt's uncle Ziro orchestrate a plan to turn Jabba against the Galactic Republic by framing the [[Jedi]] for the kidnapping of his son. While [[Anakin Skywalker]] and his newly assigned apprentice [[Ahsoka Tano]] attempt to deliver the child back to his father, [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Padme Amidala]] lead separate investigations to uncover Dooku and Ziro's plot.
The film serves as a pilot episode to the television [[star wars: the clone wars|series of the same name]], which premiered on [[Cartoon Network]] two months after the film's release.

title: rotta_the_hutt
body: Rotta, is a [[Star Wars]] character, he was a male Hutt and the son of [[Jabba the Hutt]]. During the Clone Wars, he was secretly kidnapped by the Confederacy of Independent Systems, which was orchestrated by [[Count Dooku]] with help from Ziro, Rotta's great-uncle. The plot was meant to discredit the [[jedi|Jedi Order]] and scuttle negotiations between the Galactic Republic and the Hutts, but the Jedi were able to rescue him. He was kidnapped by Asajj Ventress and taken to the planet Teth. A Jedi rescue team consisting of [[Anakin Skywalker]] and his Padawan [[Ahsoka Tano]] traveled to Teth to rescue him. He then became sick and nearly died on his way to Tatooine but survived thanks to Ahsoka Tano. After Anakin Skywalker and Tano evaded Dooku, who tried to kill Rotta and blame the Jedi, Rotta was returned to his father. Rotta was later present when Baron Notluwiski Papanoida visited Jabba's Palace. In 20 BBY, Ventress returned to [[Tatooine]], and wished to avoid attention from Jabba as she had previously kidnapped his son.

title: tacet_mark_(wuthering_waves)
body:
Special [[body markings]] found on all [[Wuthering Waves]] Resonators and throughout SOL3 (the game's world). All Resonators can channel power through their Tacet Mark to exhibit a power called a Forte. The release design of Tacet Marks resemble a sound wave diagram in line with the game's focus on sound-related themes, whereas its original design looked closer to a stretched-out star.

Note that Tacet Marks can vary in their activation state, appearance and location on a character's body but keep the same basic structure. Visit each character's individual wiki for more information on where to find their specific Tacet Marks.

[b]Note:[/b] [[Shorekeeper (wuthering Waves)|]] sets a precedent where some playable resonators may [i]not[/i] have a Tacet Mark. Only tag Tacet Mark on characters that show the current design or confirm with the character tag wiki for information on the location, if applicable, of a Tacet Mark.

h4. Examples

* !asset #20831947: Tacet Mark
* !post #7794195: Active Tacet Mark running down [[Jinhsi (Wuthering Waves)|]]'s back.
* !post #7595024: Inactive Tacet Mark on [[Male Rover (Wuthering Waves)|]]'s right hand.
* !post #7916341: [[Sanhua (Wuthering Waves)|]]'s right iris and pupil are a Tacet Mark.
* !post #8102708: [[Xiangli Yao]]'s Tacet Mark is just below his right shoulder.

title: shorekeeper_(wuthering_waves)
body:
Playable character in [[Wuthering Waves]].

Leader of the Black Shores, a research organization that has developed a Lament (disaster) prediction system. [spoiler]Originally, when [[Rover (Wuthering Waves)|]] founded and led the Black Shores, Shorekeeper was their assistant. She was later granted leadership over the Black Shores and served as a key to the Tethys System's computations which guided the Black Shores' future activities.[/spoiler]

Shorekeeper does not have a [[Tacet Mark (Wuthering Waves)|]].

title: sports_bottle
body:
Reusable and resealable [[water bottle]] designed for opening and drinking with one hand which is achieved by using flip-top, disc-top or push-pull cap. They are also more durable and usually have a more streamlined design than the normal cheap plastic bottles used for bottle water. 

While sports bottle can function like [[thermos]], the key difference is the ease of drinking with a sport bottle compared to a thermos.

Can be made from plastic, aluminum or ceramic.

title: the_ghost_and_molly_mcgee
body:
[i][b]The Ghost and Molly McGee[/b][/i] (previously titled [i][b]The Curse of Molly McGee[/b][/i]) is a musical animated buddy comedy television series, created by Bill Motz and Bob Ruth. It premiered on Disney Channel on October 1, 2021.

h4. External links

title: manaphy
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #490 in the National PokéDex, a Water type Mythical Pokémon.
Manaphy is a small, blue, aquatic Pokémon with stubby feet and club-like arms that are longer than its body. It has a red gem on its chest and a yellow dot below the gem. It has [[yellow sclera]], [[blue eyes]] and [[antennae]]. Known for its [[Heart Swap (pokemon)|]] signature move.

Although it is a mythical Pokémon, it has the ability to breed ([[Phione]]). Although Manaphy's offsprings will never evolve into Manaphy. 
It is member of the "Sea Guardians":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Legendary_duo#Sea_guardians with Phione. 

Japanese Name: [b]Manaphy[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Phione]]
Next Pokémon: [[Darkrai]]

title: rick_sanchez
body:
Titular character in [[Rick and Morty]].

The smartest man in the multiverse and depressed alcoholic. Grandfather of [[Morty Smith]] and [[Summer Smith]], father of [[Beth Smith]] and father-in-law of [[Jerry Smith]].

There are multiple versions of this character from different universes in the series. This tag can be used when any one of them is portrayed.

Rick was originally voiced by [[justin Roiland (person)|Justin Roiland]] from Season 1 to 6 but was later replaced by Ian Cardoni starting Season 7 due to Roiland being fired due to domestic abuses charges and his increasing unprofessional behavior at work.
H4.Alternative versions of Rick
* [[Pickle Rick]]
* [[Rick Prime]]

title: rick_prime
body:
Sanchez of the Prime Dimension, also known as Rick Prime, is the overarching antagonist of [[Rick and Morty]], as well as the catalyst for the events of the series.

He was the [[rick sanchez|Rick]] who was responsible for the deaths of Diane in every single dimension and Beth Sanchez in Dimension C-137.
Rick C-137 attempted to find and kill Rick Prime throughout the multiverse for decades, killing countless other Ricks in the process. Rick eventually landed in Rick Prime's original dimension and took his place, kickstarting the events of the series.

title: pickle_rick
body: Pickle version of [[Rick Sanchez]], first seen in a teaser for Season 3 of [[Rick and Morty]]. He appears in the episode of the same name and makes a cameo appearance in Edge of Tomorty: Rick Die Rickpeat in a death crystal vision.

title: alena_(dq4)
body: One of the main characters in [[Dragon Quest IV]]. Also known as Arena or Alina. Primarily a martial artist, using [[claws]] like the [[Martial Artist (dq3)|]] of [[Dragon Quest III]], she is the princess of Santohaim (localized as Santeem in the NES version and Zamoksva in the [[Nintendo DS]] remake). Alena is easily recognizable by her [[long hair|long]] [[curly hair|curly]] [[red hair]] (sometimes drawn [[orange hair|orange]] or [[brown hair|brown]]), [[cape]], and distinctive [[hat]]. In the DS remake, she has a Russian accent.

As with [[anus]], use this tag for images where the anus is fully visible.

title: sitting
body:
The butt resting on a surface (often a [[chair]], [[couch]], or [[bench]]), possibly in addition to the legs or feet. For a position with the knees on the floor, use [[kneeling]] (except with seiza below).

h4. Examples

* !post #3279793: (left to right: [[yokozuwari]], [[butterfly sitting]], [[wariza]], [[hugging own legs]])
* !post #2866134: (left to right: [[indian style]], [[seiza]], [[knees up]], [[wariza]], [i]hidden[/i], [[crossed ankles]])

h4. Related tags

h6. Positions

* [[Butterfly sitting]]: Rump on floor, knees splayed, soles of feet joined together.
* [[Crossed legs]]: Rump on chair, one leg on top of the other at the knee.
* [[Figure four sitting]]: in a chair, the ankle or calf of one leg resting on the knee of the other.
* [[Indian style]]: Rump on floor, legs crossed at the ankles like a pretzel.
* [[Lotus position]]: like Indian style, but with feet placed on opposite thighs with soles facing upward and heels close to the abdomen.
* [[Seiza]]: Rump on legs, both legs below body.
* [[Sitting backwards]]: in a chair, facing the backrest.
* [[Sitting sideways]]: in a chair, facing the side.
* [[Wariza]]: Rump on floor, legs bent back on either side.
* [[Yokozuwari]]: Rump on floor, legs both to the same side.

h6. Other sitting tags

* [[Invisible chair]] (sitting on air)
* [[On bench]]

body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-A. Kouda is extremely shy to the point where he almost never speaks unless he’s using his Quirk, which allows him to control animals with his voice.

title: sato_rikido
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-A. His Quirk allows him to increase his strength if he consumes at least ten grams of sugar, at the cost of losing his cognitive functions. 

He’s also a talented baker.

title: hagakure_toru_(cosplay)
body: [[Cosplay]] of [[Boku No Hero Academia]]'s [[Hagakure Toru]], [[invisible|at least to the extent that such a thing is possible]].

title: hagakure_toru
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. She is [[invisible]] due to her quirk, which allows her body to refract and redirect light. However, her clothes remain visible, as her quirk only affects her actual body.

Her likeness was finally revealed when she was shown [[unusually visible]] in an illustration (post #6220990) drawn for the series' 34th volume, depicting her with [[messy hair|messy]] [[green hair]] and [[thick eyelashes]]. Due to this, it is made clear that her "hero outfit" is simply her being [[nude]] save for her gloves and shoes.

title: shoji_mezo
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

One of the quieter students of Class 1-A. Despite his menacing appearance and grotesque Quirk, Shouji is actually very gentle and kindhearted.

title: kaminari_denki
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. Kaminari is not the sharpest tool in the shed, doing poorly in tests and often making a fool out of himself, especially if he overuses his electricity-generating quirk and short-circuits his brain. This usually leads to him being teased by [[Jiro Kyoka]].

He has parted [[blonde hair]] with a black lightning-shaped streak, fitting with his quirk.

title: jiro_kyoka
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

A student in Class 1-A. Outspoken, snarky, and typically unenthusiastic, Jirou also has an interest in rock music (something she’s actually quite embarrassed about).

She has [[short hair|short]], indigo [[blue hair]] and [[black eyes]]. She sometimes wears red [[facial mark|facial marks]]. She has [[long earlobes]] shaped like [[audio jack]]s. There is a highlight on her hair that resembles the trace of a sound wave.

Her quirk is "earphone jack", which grants her the unique "earlobe jacks" that she can extend at will. She can plug the earlobe jack onto any surface to increase her sound reception from the distance, as well as using it to "amplify" her heartbeat to create an earthquake-like shockwave.

Her mother is [[Jirou Mika]].

title: aoyama_yuga
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-A. His Quirk gives him the ability to shoot lasers from his navel, though shooting for more than a second gives him stomach problems. A very flashy and narcissistic boy.

He has [[parted bangs|parted]] [[blonde hair|blond hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He likes to [[sparkle]]. His hero costume resembles [[armor]].

title: tetsutetsu_tetsutetsu
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-B. A hot-blooded student with a hardening Quirk, much like his friendly rival [[Kirishima Eijiro]].

title: kirishima_eijiro
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. A passionate young man who often brings up the concept of manliness, and admires tough guys. Often seen with [[Bakugou Katsuki]] and is one of the only students who tries to get along with him.

His Quirk allows him to harden his body, making it tough and rock-like.

He has [[red eyes]], [[spiked_hair|spiked]] [[red hair]] and [[sharp teeth]].

title: yaoyorozu_momo
body:
A character from Class 1-A in [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i]. She is the class vice president alongside [[Iida Tenya]]. 

She is one of two students chosen to attend U.A. via recommendations. Intelligent and polite, Momo is seen as a natural leader, although she is prone to losing confidence, especially when comparing herself to [[Todoroki Shoto]].

Her quirk gives her the ability to make anything she has knowledge of using her body.

She has [[black hair]] [[hair_pulled_back|pulled back]]  in a [[ponytail]], and [[large breasts]]. Her hero costume is a red [[bodysuit]] with a [[center opening]], exposing her [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]] (in order to make more surface area available for creating large objects).

title: endeavor_(boku_no_hero_academia)
body:

His real name is Todoroki Enji.
Often with the hero [[Hawks (boku no hero academia)|]].

title: todoroki_shoto
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-A, chosen to enter U.A. via official recommendations. Despite being the ace of his class, Todoroki is very aloof and anti-social, although he gradually warms up to a few of his classmates as the story progresses.

His father, [[Endeavor (boku No Hero Academia)|Endeavor]], is the No. 2 Hero, but Todoroki holds a massive grudge against him thanks to a very rough childhood.

He has [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[red hair|red]] and [[white hair]], [[heterochromia]] (one [[grey eyes|grey]] and one [[blue eyes|blue]]), and a [[burn scar|burn]] [[scar on face| scar]]. His Quirk lets him produce [[fire]] from the left side of his body and [[ice]] from the right.

title: bags_under_eyes
body:
Dark circles or puffiness directly under the eyes. This can occur for a number of reasons, but is often used to indicate stress, [[sleepy|sleepiness]], [[exhausted|exhaustion]], or to give characters a dark appearance. 

Characters frequently seen with this trait include:
* [[Aizawa Shota]] and [[Shinso Hitoshi]] from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]

title: awase_yosetsu

title: hado_nejire
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

A third-year student at U.A. High School. Nejire's quirk allows her to convert her vitality into pure energy and to release this energy in the form of shockwaves. Nejire is enthusiastic, cheery, very talkative and endlessly curious girl, showing interest in other people's unique physical features and being easily distracted by them. She is a notably smart, thanks to her inquisitive and chatty demeanor. 

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|extremely long]], [[light blue hair]] that reaches all the way down to her legs and apparently twists around itself at the waist area. She also wears a [[waistcoat]] over her [[school uniform]]. Her hero costume consists of a [[skin tight]] [[bodysuit]] and a pair of [[white gloves]] on her hands, as well as two strands of an unknown material (possibly her hair) that twist into [[drill hair|spiral horns]]. 

h4. External links

* "My Hero Academia Wiki: Nejire Hadou":http://bokunoheroacademia.wikia.com/wiki/Nejire_Hado

title: kendo_itsuka

A student in class 1-B. She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] in a [[side ponytail]]. Her quirk seems to be being able to enlarge and strengthen her hands.

title: midoriya_izuku
body:
The main protagonist of [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. Born without a Quirk and therefore dubbed “Quirkless”, Izuku has been relentlessly bullied by [[Bakugou Katsuki]] ever since he was four. In spite of being timid, he displays a strong admiration for heroes, often taking notes on their Quirks, and idolizes [[All Might]]. 

Often referred to as “Deku”, which is another reading of his name that can refer to a wooden figure or puppet. Bakugou uses it as an insult, while [[Uraraka Ochaco]] uses it affectionately. [spoilers]It has long since become his hero name.[/spoilers]

He has curly [[green hair]] and [[freckles]], and his hero costume consists of a [[green bodysuit]] with [[white gloves]] and a [[mask]]. Almost never seem without his iconic [[red footwear]]. Later on, [spoilers]a [[yellow cape]] is integrated into his hero costume.[/spoilers]

title: dragon_quest_iii
body:
The third game in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series, originally released in 1988 for the [[Famicom]] and later brought to North America (as [i]Dragon Warrior III[/i]) in 1991.  Enhanced remakes have since been made for the [[Super Famicom]] and [[Game Boy Color]], though only the latter was released outside of Japan. Much later, a HD-2D remake for modern consoles was released.

This game was the first to include a gender option for the main player-character.  It also introduced character classes to the series: [[Warrior (dq3)|]], [[Priest_(dq3)|]], [[Mage_(dq3)|]], [[Martial artist (dq3)|]], [[Merchant_(dq3)|]], [[Gadabout (dq3)|]], and [[Sage_(dq3)|]]. The Super Famicom remake introduced an additional [[Thief_(dq3)|]] class while the HD-2D remake introduced the [[Monster Wrangler (DQ3)|]].

title: warrior_(dq3)
body:
A character class in [[Dragon Quest III]]. Japanese name 戦士 (Senshi), which is often translated as warrior. The female version has long purple hair (some fan art gave it a more natural color), usually blue eyes, and wears a red [[bikini armor|bikini-style armor]] with shoulder pads, red boots, red gloves over dark sleeves, and a red helmet with wings and a blue or purple medallion on the forehead.

Note that her upper body garb is reminiscent of [[valkyrie_(vnd)|Valkyrie]] from [[Valkyrie no Densetsu]], while the color scheme resembles [[Princess Athena]]'s.

title: martial_artist_(dq3)
body: A character class in [[Dragon Quest III]]. Japanese name 武闘家 (Butouka). Fights either barehanded or with [[claws]]. When not in her usual martial artist outfit, she can be identified by her [[black hair]] and [[short hair|short]] [[twintails]] hairstyle.

title: griffin_&_kryuger
body:
[b]Griffin and Kryuger[/b] is a private military contractor and security consultant company in [[Girls' Frontline]], founded by [[griffin (girls' frontline)|Griffin Lyons]] and [[Berezovich Kryuger (girls' frontline)|]], and the employer of the player, the Commander. Besides humans, the PMC is known for its employment of androids (Dolls) built by the I.O.P. Manufacturing Company, modified for Tactical use (T-Dolls). At the start of the game, they're tasked with suppressing an AI rebellion that occurred in another company towards the west, [[Sangvis Ferri]].

h4. See also

* [[Griffin & Kryuger logo]]
* [[Griffin & Kryuger military uniform]]
other_names: グリフィン&クルーガー

title: commander_(girls'_frontline)_(madcore)
body:
[[MADCORE]]'s rendition of the [[Commander (girls' frontline)|]].

Possessing exceptional skill in commanding his troops, he was forced against his will to take charge of Area S09 for the Griffin & Kryuger Private Military Company after recognition of his social service record. He is known for wearing a [[red suit|red]] (formerly green) [[suit]], a [[blue ascot|blue]] [[ascot]], and a [[monocle]].

title: fighter_jet
body:
A [[jet]]-powered [[aircraft]] specifically [[military vehicle|designed for warfare]], and outfitted with turbine jets. Fighting in conflicts as close support for ground troops, and maintaining air superiority in a dogfight. These crafts can travel at supersonic speeds of Mach 1, 2, and 3; armed with an array of guided and unguided penetration bombs, missiles, and vulcan cannons.

Pilots that fly them are equipped with a [[g-suit]] and an oxygen mask on their flight helmet, to allow them to withstand the heavy g-force from maneuvering the aircraft at supersonic speed, and to breathe easily while flying at altitudes of more than 20,000 feet.

h4. Examples
* !post #8115012
* !post #8114904
* !post #8364023

title: satan_(mythology)
body:
In Western religious mythology, Satan is the source of the world's evils. Originally one of God's angels, he rebelled and caused Adam and Eve to fall to sin. He is also known as [[Lucifer (mythology)|]] in certain religious traditions. In traditional [[christian mythology|Christian]] theology, Satan is also the ruler of [[Hell]], tormenting unrepentant sinners for all eternity.

h1. See also
* [[Baphomet (mythology)|]]
* [[demon]]
* [[inverted cross]]
* [[occult]]
* [[pentagram]]
* [[Sigil of Lucifer]]

title: cobra_command
body:
Fictional [[terrorist]] organization from the [[G.I. Joe]] series. They are the main antagonists in the original comics and animated TV show.

[b][i]Cobra Command[/i][/b], also known simply as [i][b]Cobra[/b][/i], is an evil and sinister paramilitary organization which seeks to take over the Free World through [[terrorism]] and using exotic, advanced and sophisticated weaponry and experimental combat vehicles.

Cobra is under the leadership of [[Cobra Commander]], its original founder and creator. [[Destro]] is its main weapons and ordinance supplier.

title: g.i._joe
body:
[b][i]G.I. Joe[/i][/b] is a famous and classic line of [[military]] [[action figure]]s produced and owned by the [[Hasbro]] American toy company. 

"G.I." ([i]Government Issue[/i]) is a generic term for U.S. soldiers. The development of the first G.I. Joe toy led to the coining of the term "action figure". G.I. Joe's appeal to children has made it an American icon among toys. The action figure line has also become famous in many different countries across the rest of the world.

The G.I. Joe trademark has been used by Hasbro to title two different toy lines. 

The original 12-inch (30 cm) line that began in 1964 centered on realistic action figures. In the United Kingdom, this line was licensed to Palitoy and known as [i]Action Man[/i]. 

The initial product offering represented four of the branches of the U.S. armed forces with the Action Soldier (U.S. Army), Action Sailor (U.S. Navy), Action Pilot (USAF), Action Marine (USMC) and later on, the Action Nurse. 

Then in 1982, the line was relaunched in a much smaller 3.75-inch (9.5 cm) scale complete with new futuristic vehicles, detailed playsets, and a complex and rich background story involving an ongoing struggle between the [i]G.I. Joe [/i] team and the evil [[Cobra Command]] organization which seeks to take over the Free World through [[terrorism]] and using advanced and sophisticated weaponry. 

The new 80s line was initially intended as a means to sell the new toy vehicles, but over time the unique characters and their different and detailed action figures became much more popular and extremely sought after to this day.

The 1982 toy line became extremely successful and was also supported by two animated series as well as a major [[comic]] series published initially by [[Marvel]] Comics which expanded each character's background and mythos which were mostly developed by Marvel writer/artist "Larry Hama":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Hama .

title: gardening_shears
body:
A variety of [[shears]], effectively a heavier duty [[scissors]], used in gardening and agriculture.

h4. Types

* [b][[Gardening shears]][/b]: Small shears similar to household scissors used for pruning small branches from plants.  Also known as [i]secateurs[/i] in UK English.
** Straight blade: Pruning shears with straight blades, nearly identical to household scissors. Ex: post #6087615.
*** Anvil pruners: Pruners where it features a single cutting blade that meets up with a widen flat end when cutting.
** Curved blade: Pruning shears with a curved blade.
*** Bypass pruners: Pruners where one blade is convex and the other blade is concave, used to better hold branches. Ex: post #5969022.
*** Parrot-beak pruners: Pruners where both blades are concave to better hold branches as they're cutting.
* [b]Loppers[/b]: A larger long-handled two-handed version of pruning shears.  Used for cutting branches that pruning shears can't handle. Features the same different blade types as pruning shears. ex: post #5038306.
* [b]Hedging shears[/b]: Large long-handled two-handed shears featuring long blades for trimming hedges and shrubs.  Also known as a manual hedge trimmers, but due to the commonality of motorized hedge trimmers they're frequently branded as hedging shears to better differentiate them. Ex: post #1705185.

h4. See also

* [[Hedge trimmer]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pruning shears":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pruning_shears]
* "Wikipedia: Loppers":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loppers]
* "Wikipedia: Hedge trimmer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hedge_trimmer]

title: karakai_jouzu_no_takagi-san
body:
A 2013 to 2023 manga series written by [[Yamamoto Souichirou]]. It was first published as a one shot in Gekkan Shonen Sunday in June 2012 and then serialized in Gessan Mini since June 2013. An anime adaptation was produced by Shin-Ei Animation and aired during the Winter 2018 season, with a season 2 adaptation following during the Summer 2019 season. A third season followed, airing during the Winter 2022 season.

The series follows [[Nishikata]], a middle school student who is teased by his classmate [[Takagi-san]], and his efforts to try and make a successful comeback--to cause Takagi to blush from embarrassment.

There are also 4 manga spin-offs based on side characters and future events.
* [[Karakai Jouzu no (Moto) Takagi-san]] [spoiler]is about an older Nishikata and Takagi who are married and have a child named Chii.[/spoiler]
* [[Karakai Jouzu (?) no Nishikata-san]] [spoilers]is about the everyday stories of Chii, now the same age as Nishikata and Takagi in the first manga, as she tries to be just like her mother to another male classmate to mixed results.[/spoiler]

title: thermos
body:
A container or vessel designed to keep liquids hot or cold for long periods of time.  This is accomplished by the container being composed of two flasks, one within the other, and joined at the neck. The gap between the two flasks is partially evacuated of air to produce a near vacuum which helps to impede the transfer of heat between the contents and the outside.  

While these are known as a vacuum flask or vacuum bottle, these should not be confused with a Büchner flask used in laboratory vacuum filtration, which are also known as a vacuum flask.

h4. See also 

* [[Bottle]]
* [[Flask]]
* [[Sports bottle]]
* [[Tumbler]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is a [[side bun]] decorated with a [[hair flower|flower]] [[flower knot|knot]] [[kanzashi]] with [[tassel hair ornament|tassels]], a [[metal hairband|metal]] [[hairband]] and a [[kagami mochi]] [[mochi hair ornament|ornament]] on top of her regular triangle ornaments. title: battle_angel_alita
body:
A [[science fiction]] and [[cyberpunk]] manga series created by [[Kishiro Yukito]] in 1990. Known in Japan as [i]Gunnm[/i] (銃夢, pronounced [i]Ganmu[/i], meaning "Gun Dream"), and in the west as [i]Battle Angel Alita[/i].

The series tells the story of [[Alita]], an amnesiac female [[cyborg]] found by cybermedic expert [[Ido Daisuke]], who repaired her body and also gave her her name.

The rebuilt Alita soon discovers that she possesses instinctive knowledge of the legendary martial art Panzer Kunst. She must learn to navigate, exist, and fight in the Scrapyard, whose inhabitants themselves live in the shadow of the tantalizingly close floating city, Salem. Her journeys take her across the Scrapyard and surrounding areas, as she tries to recall more of her past.

The manga was later made into a 2019 live action movie called [[Alita: Battle Angel]].

h4. Characters

title: usada_pekora_(prisoner)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Usada Pekora]]. It was revealed on April Fools 2021, and is based on the running gag of her being often referred as a "war criminal" due to the cruel exploits and human experiments she runs on NPCs in Minecraft, and her constant pranks on other hololive members.

It is essentially [[prison clothes]], consisting of a [[black headwear|black]] and [[white headwear|white]] [[striped headwear|striped]] hat covering her ears, a [[metal collar]], and a [[long shirt|long]] [[torn shirt|torn]] [[striped shirt]]. Don-chan is now wrapped around her right leg and holds on to a large carrot-shaped a [[ball and chain restraint]]. She also wears [[no pants]] and is [[barefoot]] with this outfit.

Fitting with the prisoner aesthetic, her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[messy hair]] with her [[twin braids]] partially undone.

body:

title: boc'z_(umamusume)
body:
Five-person vocal group and unit in [[Umamusume]] originally debuting on April Fools' 2023 with a music video ([i]"Hat on Your Head!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BzRmdQioIQU][/i]) and a mock website listing the group's manifesto with personalized bios for each unit member as though they were a real-life music group.

BoC'z is a wordplay that can be read as "boushis" in Japanese (literally "The Hats"). Its members are all hat-wearing umamusume and consist of the following:

* [[Matikane Tannhauser (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|816-n]] ([[Matikane Tannhauser (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Rice Shower (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|ORYZA]] ([[Rice Shower (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Mr. C.B. (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|CAP.B]] ([[Mr. C.B. (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Hokko Tarumae (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|MACOtMai]] ([[Hokko Tarumae (Umamusume)|]]) 
* [[Cheval Grand (BoC'z) (Umamusume)|MARINE.C]] ([[Cheval Grand (Umamusume)|]])

For 5th Event -YELL-, the rest of the [[V Sisters]] were added to the formation:
* QueenV ([[Verxina (Umamusume)|]])
* Lil♡V ([[Vivlos (Umamusume)|]])

[tn](Pseudonyms are stylized as above with spaces and capitalization exactly as written.)[/tn]

h4. See also

* [[UMA STARS (Umamusume)]] (April Fools 2024)

title: la_seizel
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|]] series, introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and returns in [[Rance VI]] as a major antagonist.

A former [[Angel]], La Seizel is a Dark Lord affiliated with the [[Kayblis|]] Faction, and the twin sister of [[La Hawzel]], who is affiliated with the [[Hornet (rance)|]] Faction. Unlike her calm, compassionate sister, Seizel is volatile, selfish, and harbors a deep hatred of her sister, merely joining the Kayblis Faction because Hawzel joined the Hornet Faction.

A former [[Angel]], La Hawzel is a Dark Lord affiliated with the [[Hornet (rance)|]] Faction, and the twin sister of [[La Seizel]], who is affiliated with the [[Kayblis]] Faction. Unlike her volatile, selfish sister, Hawzel is calm, compassionate, and close friends with Hornet.

title: erika_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Erika[/b] is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

A cute Gym Leader who loves Grass-type Pokémon, this well-mannered Trainer teaches flower arrangement in Kanto [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Vileplume]].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[parted bangs]]. In her [[pokemon frlg|FRLG]] outfit, she wears a [[purple hairband]], a [[yellow kimono|yellow]] [[poke ball print|print]] kimono with [[long sleeves|long]] and [[wide sleeves]], a [[purple hakama|purple]] [[hakama skirt]], [[white legwear|white]] [[tabi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[okobo]].

title: source_filmmaker_(medium)
body:
[b]Source Filmmaker[/b] (often abbreviated as [b]SFM[/b]) is a video capture and editing application developed by [[Valve Software]] for use within the Source game engine.

Source Filmmaker was initially used as an internal tool for the development of animated shorts. Some of the earliest examples are the "release trailer":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D8jQJ5SFqBU for Day of Defeat and the "Meet the Heavy":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jHgZh4GV9G0 short for [[Team Fortress 2]].

Source Filmmaker has been in open beta as of July 11, 2012, and is available for free through [[Steam (platform)|]], where uses can import custom models and maps compatible with the Source engine and use them in their own animations.

h4. See also

* [[3d]]
* [[video]]

h4. External links

* "Official Website":http://www.sourcefilmmaker.com/
* "Steam store page":http://store.steampowered.com/app/1840/
* "Wikipedia: Source Filmmaker":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_Filmmaker
* "Wikipedia: Source (game engine)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_%28game_engine%29

title: alvida_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Former captain of the Alvida Pirates, now allied with [[Buggy the Clown]]. She sees herself as the most beautiful lady in the world.

Having consumed the Sube Sube no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], her skin can become slick and friction-less. 

[spoiler]Before consuming said fruit, she was [[obese]]. Despite this, she still saw herself as the most beautiful, smashing anyone who disagreed with her iron mace.[/spoiler]

title: donquixote_doflamingo
body:
[[One Piece]] character. The captain of the [[donquixote_family|Donquixote Pirates]]. King of Dressrosa and one of the [[Shichibukai]].

He is the son [[Donquixote Homing]] and the older brother of [[Donquixote Rocinante]], [spoiler]both of whom he killed out of feeling betrayed by them.[/spoiler]

Having consumed the Ito Ito no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can create strings to cut or pull things.

[spoiler]Former Celestial Dragon, descended from the Donquixote Family. After being defeated by both [[Monkey D. Luffy]] and [[Trafalgar Law]], his position as a Warlord was revoked and he was imprisoned at [[Impel Down]]'s Level 6 for abusing his privilege and ruling the kingdom of Dressrosa with an iron fist.[/spoiler]
other_names: ドンキホーテ・ドフラミンゴ

title: charlotte_linlin
body:
Charlotte Linlin, better known as [b]"Big Mom"[/b], is a character from [[One Piece]]. One of the Four Emperors and the female pirate with the highest bounty in the world.

"Big Mom" is the leader of the titular Big Mom Pirates, who gained the nickname for the infamous tactic of "marrying" men of various races for the sole purpose of siring children to use them as political pawns to arrange marriages with various countries under her influence. She has 43 "husbands" (all of whom were immediately abandoned as soon as their child was born), 46 sons, and 39 daughters, and had given birth every year until she was 60 years old.

Having eaten the Soru Soru no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], Big Mom has the ability to manipulate the soul of anyone who has a fear of death or allowed her to do so, which allows her to cut the lifespan of that soul and put it inside various objects. She created various familiars with these powers to supplement her already superhuman strength in battle.

h4. See also
* [[Napoleon (one piece)|]]
* [[Zeus (one piece)|]]
* [[Prometheus (one piece)|]]
* [spoiler][[Hera (one piece)|]][/spoiler]
other_names: シャーロット・リンリン

title: kaidou_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character, and the main antagonist of the Wano arc. He is the captain of the Beast Pirates, the tyrannical ruler of the Wano nation, and father of [[Yamato (one piece)|]].

Having consumed the Uo Uo no Mi, Model: Seiryu [[Devil Fruit]], which grants him a near-invincible body and incredible strength, as well as allows him to transform into a huge [[eastern dragon]]. Kaidou became so strong that he developed suicidal thoughts out of boredom and aimed to create a "World of Violence" so that he would eventually be killed in a "great battle".

title: gol_d._roger
body:
Prominent background character from [[One Piece]]. The legendary "King of the Pirates" and the previous owner of the "One Piece", the eponymous treasure of the series. 

As he was suffering from an incurable disease, Roger disbanded his own pirate crew and surrendered himself to the World Government. In his hometown where he was about to be executed, he urged the spectators to find the "One Piece" and other treasures collected during his lifetime, thus starting the Golden Age of Pirates.

[spoiler]He was the lover of [[Portgas D. Rouge]] and father of [[Portgas D. Ace]].[/spoiler]

title: shichibukai
body:
The [b]Seven Warlords of the Sea[/b] (王下七武海, Ōka Shichibukai) are a group of seven pirates allied with the World Government in [[One Piece]]. The roster has fluctuated as the story has progressed, but there's never more than seven at the same time.

However as a result of both Sir [[Crocodile (one piece)|]] enacting Operation Utopia in Arabasta and [[Donquixote Doflamingo]] becoming the tyrannical ruler of Dressrosa, the system was eventually disbanded.

h4.Members (as of the disbandment)
* [[Bartholomew Kuma]]
* [[Boa Hancock]]
* [[Buggy the Clown]]
* [[Dracule Mihawk]]
* [[Edward Weevil]]

h4.Former Members
* [[Crocodile (one Piece)|]]
* [[Jinbe (one piece)|]]
* [[Marshall D. Teach]]
* [[Gecko Moria]]
* [[Trafalgar Law]]
* [[Donquixote Doflamingo]]

h4.Candidates
There have been other pirates who have been selected to become Shichibukai but did not receive membership for one reason or another.
* [[Portgas D. Ace]]

title: interspecies
body:
Sexual or romantic acts between members of different species (mostly between a human and a humanoid, but different species of humanoids are also acceptable). Examples include a [[furry]] character with a regular human, a human with a [[humanoid robot]] or sentient [[mecha]] (e.g. [[Transformers]] or [[Yuusha series]] robots), a human with a humanoid [[Pokemon (creature)|Pokemon]] such as a [[Machoke]], [[Hypno]], [[Gardevoir]], or a human with a [[monster|monstrous]] character such as a [[goblin]], an [[orc]], a [[Hilichurl (genshin impact)|]], or [[Bowser]].

Do not tag [[bestiality]] as interspecies; bestiality is for sex or romance with animals or beasts, interspecies is for sex or romance with humanoids.

title: ranma-chan
body:
The canonical genderswapped version of [[Saotome Ranma]]. In the series [[Ranma 1/2]], Ranma is cursed so that whenever he gets soaked with cold water he transforms into a girl. He's able to revert back to a man when soaked with hot water. 

In terms of appearance, she very closely resembles Ranma's male form, but has [[red hair]] as opposed to [[black hair]], is about a head height shorter, and of course has female primary and secondary characteristics ([[breasts]], body shape, etc).

Only tag as [[Saotome Ranma]] if her male form is also present. In situations where she appears alongside her original male self, the [[dual persona]] tag should be used.

Voiced by [[Hayashibara Megumi]].

title: salome_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A biblical figure who was the daughter of Herod II and Herodias. At a grand banquet, and at her mother's behest, Salome made a request to Herod Antipas; the head of John the Baptist given to her on a platter, which was thus brought to her.

In Fate/Grand Order, she is depicted as a somewhat [[yandere]] woman, and her dialogue reveals that she fell in love with John the Baptist, which she says was the reason for her request to "stay" together with him. [spoiler]In fact, the skull that she wields is actually of John the Baptist's with his soul still inside. John treated himself as a half-reluctant mentor who seems to be used to Salome's antics.[/spoiler]

h4.Costumes

* [[salome_(event_portrait)_(fate)|Heroic Spirit Event Portrait]]

title: marasai
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-108 Marasai[/b]

Originally developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]] as the MSA-002 [[mobile_suit|MS]] for the [[AEUG]], pressure by [[titans_(gundam)|the Titans]] meant the type was forced into service by the oppressive elite Federation unit in mostly orange colors during U.C. 0087. While it was a comprehensive all-round improvement over the pitiful [[Hizack]], its weapon selection was much more limited, as it could only load advanced beam weapons. Later replaced by the more capable [[Barzam]] in frontline service. 

After the [[zeta_gundam|Gryphs War]] the last surviving Marasai units were acquired by [[Neo Zeon]] who used them to fill their ranks with a gray color scheme several years later. Some optimized green and grey Marasais even ended up being used by [[full_frontal|"The Sleeves"]] during their [[gundam_unicorn|Attack on Torrington Base]].

title: zudah
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]EMS-10 Zudah[/b]

An early experimental [[Zeon]] combat [[mobile_suit|MS]] rival of the [[Zaku I]] developed by the Zimmad Company. It was fast, had a versatile array of weapons which included a 135mm anti-ship rifle and was perceived as vastly outperforming the Zaku I - except it was all propaganda: the suit was prone to overloading its engine and exploding at random, and it did so in multiple occasions despite endless attempts at fixing such horrible behavior, being deemed a total and utter failure

However this problem was eventually solved and the Zudah was actually modernized and used in battle some time later by selected Zeon and [[Neo Zeon]] units in a limited capacity.

It consists of a [[plume]]d [[shako cap]], a [[gold trim|gold-trimmed]] [[two-sided jacket]] ([[black jacket|black]] on the outside, red on the inside), a [[black leotard|black]] [[lace-trimmed leotard|lace-trimmed]] [[strapless leotard]] worn over a black [[bodystocking]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[underbust]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[showgirl skirt]], and black fold-over [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[thigh boots]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[very long hair|very long]] with and [[grey hair|grey]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] into an  [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical hairstyle]] with a [[single side bun|single]] [[side up bun]] on one side and a [[one side up]] on the other.

title: molotov_cocktail
body:
An improvised [[fire|incendiary]] [[bomb]] made simply by filling a glass [[bottle]] with fuel or any flammable substance, sealing it with a piece of cloth and then [[burning|lighting]] the cloth on fire when used. The bottle is tossed at the target, which immediately is covered by the [[burning]] fuel after the bottle breaks upon contact.

It has been used in violent [[rioting|riot]]s, by different gangs and various non-state combatants different parts of the world.

Its common name comes from an insulting reference by Finnish soldiers (who used the "cocktail" to great effect during the Winter war, and later [[World War II]]) to [[Soviet]] foreign minister [[Vyacheslav Molotov]], who was responsible for the partition of [[Finland]] during [[Joseph Stalin]]'s regime. At one point, Molotov claimed that the bombing campaign during the Winter war was a "humanitarian operation", which spawned sarcastic remarks among the Finnish population referring to the Soviet bombs as "Molotov's basket". Molotov himself, obviously, highly disliked the name.

h4. See also
* [[flamethrower]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: carrie_kelley
body: Caroline Keene "Carrie" Kelley is a superheroine from Frank Miller's graphic novels The Dark Knight Returns (1986) and its sequels The Dark Knight Strikes Again (2001–2002) and The Dark Knight III: The Master Race (2015–2017). She becomes the new [[Robin (dc)|]] in The Dark Knight Returns when she saves [[batman|Batman's]] life. Later in The Dark Knight Strikes Again, she adopts the identity Catgirl, and in The Dark Knight III: The Master Race, she adopts the identity [[Batwoman]]. She was the first full-time female Robin in the history of the [[batman (series)|Batman franchise]], though Julie Madison had passed off as Robin for a brief time in a Bob Kane story published in Detective Comics #49 in March 1941.

body:

The fourth Raikage has often been used in referring for the title. He is the son of the third Raikage, succeeding his father after his death.

Notorious in the Naruto fandom for his frequent appearance in [[netorare]] works, particularly with [[Hyuuga Hinata]].

title: bismarck_zwei_(azur_lane)
body: The second, Ultra Rare-rarity, personification of [[Bismarck (Azur Lane)|]] in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Not to be confused with the original although it is specified that Bismarck [i]Zwei[/i] is the same body and memories but carrying more animalistic equipment in line with prevailing Iron Blood faction aesthetics. Voiced by [[Fukuhara Ayaka|]]. h4. Appearance [tn]See post #6321226.[/tn] She is still portrayed with the same [[blue eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]]. Her outfit still consists of a black [[military uniform]] with German flag accents on her dress with [[double-breasted]] [[buttons]], while her [[peaked cap]] retains the [[Reichsadler|Parteiadler]] ornament. She still wears the same [[fur_trim|fur-trimmed]] [[cape]] but her original [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]] are turned into black [[armored boots]]. Her [[Bismarck (coat of arms)|coat-of-arms]] is now displayed on her right shoulder and she loses the German flag. Her [[rigging]] turns into a massive animalistic style (in the form of an automaton named "Geryon") in line with the Iron Blood faction, still sporting her four 38 cm twin gun mounts and 150 mm twin gun mounts plus some 105 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the sides. h4. Skins * !post #8466342: [[Bismarck Zwei (Crystal-Clear Holiday) (azur lane)|Crystal-Clear Holiday]] (can be used with the original Bismarck via skin sharing) * !post #8207289: [[Bismarck_(wedding_dominion)_(azur_lane)|Wedding Dominion]] (can be used with the original Bismarck via skin sharing) h4. Related Characters h5. Sumner-class) * [b]Bismarck Zwei[/b] (Bismarck-class to Bismarck Zwei-class, fictional) * [[Houston II (Azur Lane)|Houston (CL-81) / Houston II]] (Northampton-class heavy cruiser to Cleveland-class light cruiser) h4. See also * [[Bismarck (Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio)]] * [[Bismarck (Kancolle)]] * [[Bismarck (Warship Girls R)]] h4. title: the_end_(minecraft)
body:
A dimension found in the game [[Minecraft]].

The End is a barren, empty dimensional plane containing a large floating island of a unique material called End Stone, dotted with Obsidian pillars. This dimension is populated by a vast number of [[enderman|Endermen]], who spawn considerably more often than in the Overworld, and one [[Ender Dragon]], an End-exclusive mob. 

(Taken from "the Minecraft wiki":http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/The_End)

She wears a [[maid]] outfit composed of a [[black dress]], a [[white apron]], [[black thighhighs]], a [[maid headdress]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]]. Additionally, she is supported by [[extra arms|multiple]] [[mechanical arms]] capable of wielding multiple cleaning tools at once. She may be accompanied by an [[eagle]] (Which itself may possess a [[smartphone]]).

title: zaku_cannon
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MS-06K Zaku Cannon[/b]

A long range artillery support [[Zeon]] [[mobile_Suit|MS]] built upon the frame of the venerable [[Zaku II]]. It possessed a 180mm gun mounted upon its backpack and slung over its left shoulder, rooughly equivalent to the ones on the [[Guntank]] and able to destroy enemy MS in a single well placed shot. 

Some units were equipped with the "Big Gun" missile launchers, fired from the waist, and sported twin [[radio antenna]]e on the head - those units were called "Rabbit Types".

title: roux_louka
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. She is a supporting character in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986. Voiced by [[Matsui Naoko]].

[b]Roux Louka[/b] is a young [[AEUG]] [[pilot]] member of the [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i] where she pilots the [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]] [[Mobile Suit]]. As a transfer MS operator Roux is the only member of the team who was not part of [[Judau Ashta]]'s band of scavengers. She is also considered by [[Bright Noa]] to be the most experienced MS pilot of the entire group.

Some fans give her the affectionate nickname [i]"Blueberry Yogurt"[/i].

title: jamru_fin
body:

[b]AMA-01X Jamru Fin[/b]

A [[Neo Zeon]] advanced transformable [[mobile suit]] designed for aerospace combat.

title: puzzle_&_dragons
body:
[b]Puzzle & Dragons[/b] (パズル&ドラゴンズ [i]Pazuru Ando Doragonzu[/i]) is a Japanese mobile game developed by GungHo Online Entertainment. The Japanese title is often shortened to パズドラ ([i]Pazudora[/i]), while the English title is often shortened to PAD.

The gameplay consists of the player going through dungeons (there are regular dungeons, special dungeons, and technical dungeons) and battling monsters and bosses via matching element tiles to attack and/or heal in order to earn various in-game currencies. Beating dungeons eventually gives enough experience points to allow the player to level up so their rank, stamina, team cost, and monster box capacity may increase. Another factor of gameplay is the player collecting, fusing, and evolving their monsters in order to make them stronger. Utilizing monster abilities and stats is vital to the gameplay, especially later on in the game.

There are approximately 1400 and counting unique monsters that can be collected by the player. These range from traditional [[dragon|dragons]], [[demon|demons]], [[ogre|ogres]], [[goblin|goblins]], and [[knight|knights]] to mythological figures from various real world cultures and religions, fictionalized versions of popular historical figures, and even third party fictional characters.

[[crossover|The game also does various collaborations with several anime and video game properties]] which are usually Japanese only. Many collaborations have been released to the international editions, however.

There have been a few anime adaptations of the game "Puzzle & Dragons x (Cross)":https://www.tv-tokyo.co.jp/anime/pad-x/ in 2016 and "PazuDora":https://anime-pad.com/index.html in 2018.

h4. See also

* [[List of Puzzle & Dragons Characters]]
* [[Emil Chronicle Online]]

h4. External links

* "Wiki of official artists":https://w.atwiki.jp/pzdr_illust/
* "Fan-compiled illustrated character list":http://www.puzzledragonx.com/en/monsterbook.asp
* "Wikipedia: Puzzle & Dragons":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puzzle_%26_Dragons

title: moral_orel
body: Moral Orel is an American adult stop-motion animated black comedy drama series created by Dino Stamatopoulos which originally aired on [[cartoon network|Cartoon Network's]] nighttime programming block [[Adult Swim]] from December 13, 2005 to December 18, 2008. The series follows the titular [[Orel Puppington]], a young, happy-go-lucky and naïve Protestant who showcases his commitment to God, while dealing with the cynicism of his abusive and alcoholic father, his lethargic mother, and the devoutly Protestant town of Moralton in which he resides.

title: villainous
body: Villainous (Spanish: Villanos) is a Mexican-American animated television and web series produced by A.I. Animation Studios for [[Cartoon Network]] and Max. It was created by Alan Ituriel, a veteran of the animation industry in [[Mexico]]. It is based on a 2012 web series of the same name which Ituriel had previously created and was initially picked up by Cartoon Network Latin America as a miniseries of ten one-minute episodes for the Cartoon Network Anything app (further episodes, along with a series of specials, were released later). The series is co-produced by Cartoon Network (through its Latin America Original Production unit) and A.I. Animation Studios. The series has since expanded onto a media franchise consistent of books and tie-ins.

title: dexter's_laboratory
body: Dexter's Laboratory is an American animated television series created by Genndy Tartakovsky for [[Cartoon Network]] and the first original series for the channel under the Cartoon Cartoons moniker. The series follows Dexter, an enthusiastic boy-genius with a hidden science laboratory in his room, which he keeps secret from his unsuspecting parents. Dexter is at constant odds with his older and more extraverted sister [[Dee Dee]], who regularly accesses the laboratory and inadvertently foils his experiments. [[Mandark]], a nefarious boy-genius classmate who lives next-door to Dexter, attempts to undermine him at every opportunity. Prominently featured in the first and second seasons are other segments focusing on superhero-based characters Monkey, Dexter's pet lab-monkey with a superhero alter ego, and the Justice Friends, a trio of superheroes who share an apartment.

title: batman:_the_brave_and_the_bold
body: Batman: The Brave and the Bold is an American animated television series based in part on the [[DC Comics]] series The Brave and the Bold which features two or more superheroes coming together to solve a crime or foil a super villain. As the title suggests, the series focuses on Batman's regular "team-ups" with various heroes similar to the most well-known version of the original comic book series. This version has a much lighter and simpler, often comic feel, targeting younger viewers more than the character's other series. The series premiered on November 14, 2008, on [[Cartoon Network]] in the United States, and ended on November 18, 2011. It also aired in Canada on Teletoon. The series was followed by a comic-book continuation which ended in 2014, and a feature-length crossover film: Scooby-Doo! & Batman: The Brave and the Bold, which aired in 2018.

title: tec-9
body:
A high capacity Swedish [[gun|pistol]] manufactured by Intratec.

There are several varations of the pistol. The TEC-DC9 was made to circumvent a California ban, and featured the slings moved to the back of the gun.

During Clinton's assault weapon ban, the AB-10 was introduced, a TEC-9 without a threaded muzzle barrel and with a 10-round magazine instead of the trademark 20 or 32 round magazines.

It is infamously pictured with many mass murderers, including the Columbine killers.

title: twitching
body:
Motions that are sudden, involuntary, sharp movements in response to agitation or stimulation. See [[flinch]] for similar motions in response to surprise or shock.

Use for momentary motions, not for sustained motions like shivering or [[trembling]].
Denoted by jagged [[motion lines]].

For the website, see [[twitch.tv|Twitch]].

h4. Specific Tags
[[twitching bulge]]
[[twitching penis]]
[[twitching pussy]]
[[twitching testicles]]

* [[trembling]]

title: motion_lines
body:
In [[comic]]s, motion lines are abstract lines that appear around a moving object or person, to make it appear as if it is moving quickly.

h4. See also

* [[speed lines]]
* [[emphasis lines]]
* [[trembling]]
* [[twitching]]
* [[attack trail]]


h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Motion lines":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motion_lines

title: speed_lines
body:
Lines drawn to emphasize the velocity of a person or object.

When used directly on objects, esp. in the foreground, these may be accompanied by [[motion blur]] effects.

When used in (or in lieu of) the background, speed lines indicate that the persons or objects in the foreground are moving past the background at high speed.

Not to be confused with [[emphasis lines]], which do not indicate motion, but rather are used dramatically to draw attention to a specific part of the image.

h4. See also

* [[motion lines]]
* [[attack trail]]

title: trembling
body:
Trembling is a reflex motion caused by cold, fear, or excitement. It can also denote instability.

Often depicted in art with short, wavy [[motion lines]] surrounding the outline of the body. (see post #1630828)
Sharper, less subtle lines depict [[twitching]], which is more violent and momentary.

Not to be confused with [[^^^]], which expresses reaction.

h4. See also

* [[shaking]]
* [[twitching]]

h4. External Definition
"The Free Dictionary":[https://www.thefreedictionary.com/tremble]

title: gridman_(character)
body:
Gridman is a Hyper Agent from the Hyper World, a parallel world to the "Computer World" a world within all computers. Originally a bodiless life form that chased Khan Digifier to the Computer World.

Originally an incorporeal being, Gridman was given a body designed by Ippei Baba from his own CG concept of a superhero. Before Gridman can leave, the Access Code (アクセスコード Akusesu Kōdo) must be entered to Junk, this password is [b]"GRIDMAN"[/b].


h4. Weapons

** Gran Acceptor (グラン=アクセプター Guran Akuseputā): A bracer on Gridman's left arm, it is connected to the Acceptor worn by Naoto.

** Grid Beam (グリッドビーム Guriddo Bīmu): A beam fired from the back of his left arm.

** Grid Hyper Beam (グリッドハイパービーム Guriddo Haipā Bīmu): Gridman's final resort attack programmed by Takeshi after Khan Digifier destroyed all of Gridman's weapon and support mech programs. It was destructive enough to destroy Khan Digifier and Takeshi's PC Computer world alone.

** Spark Beam (スパークビーム Supāku Bīmu): Energy blasts fired from his left wrist.

** Grid Light Saber (グリッドライトセイバー Guriddo Raito Seibā): A blade generated in his left hand but wielded on the right. Often used as a boomerang weapon.


h4. Techniques

** Super Conductivity Kick (超電導キック Chōdendō Kikku): An energized kick.

** Neo Super Conductivity Kick (ネオ超電導キック Neo Chōdendō Kikku): An energized kick, even more powerful than its predecessor.

** Fixer Beam (フィクサービーム Fikusā Bīmu): A beam from his chest that repairs damaged computer systems.

** Size Change: Using the upgrade program, Gridman can take on a giant size in the cyber world.

** Grid Kinesis (グリッドキネシス Guriddo Kineshisu): A technique to feed energy into the Acceptor and free Naoto from a monster's influence, waking him up.

** Super Electromagnetic Beam (超電磁ビーム Chō Denji Bīmu): A beam used to counter Stealgan's shockwave.

** Materialize Beam (実体化ビーム Jittai-ka Bīmu): Eye beams that are used to complete the schematics of Assist Weapons summoned by Ippei and Yuka.

** Forced Combine Beam: A beam used to force Naoto and Gridman to merge.


h4. Alternate forms

* [[Thunder Gridman]]
* [[King Gridman]]

title: bomber_jacket
body:
A short sturdy [[jacket]] traditionally made of [[leather jacket|leather]] and having a fitted or elastic waist, a zippered or buttoned front, and often a fleece, pile or fur collar. Also called flight jacket.

Modern bomber jackets tend to be of fabric rather than leather and may be used as sports clothes. Bomber jackets are often styled into [[letterman jacket]]s, with added details common for that style of jacket. But, the fundamental construction of the garment is very similar.

h4. Examples

h6.Traditional bomber jacket

* !post #6600576: Traditional [[leather jacket]] with a flat collar.
* !post #7000731: Traditional [[leather jacket]] with a fur collar.

h6. Modern bomber jacket

* !post #1038978: Two modern bomber jackets with stand-up stretch collars. 
* !post #4934732: Modern [[cropped jacket|cropped bomber jacket]]. 
* !post #6240023: Modern [[bomber jacket]].

title: shihakusho
body: The uniform of shinigami in [i][[Bleach]][/i]. It is by default a black [[kimono]] with a visible white inner lining.

title: blinky_(the_simpsons)
body: Blinky the Three-Eyed Fish (or simply Blinky) is a three-eyed orange [[fish]] species in [[The Simpsons]], found in the ponds and lakes outside the nuclear power plant. The Springfield Nuclear Power Plant caused the mutations.

title: dj_yellow
body:
[i][[Rhythm Tengoku]][/i] character. Only appears in the [i][[Rhythm Tengoku Gold]][/i] minigame "DJ School".

An excitable, peppy yellow humanoid who teaches his [[student (rhythm tengoku)|Student]]. Is not actually a professional DJ, as his classes are supposed to teach people how to look like one.

title: dragonlord_placidusax
body:
[b]Dragonlord Placidusax[/b] is a boss in [[Elden Ring]]. He gigantic multiheaded Ancient Dragon, although a few of his heads are missing from previous battles. His body is stony and battered, showing many wounds from his past. In a past age, Placidusax had the title of Elden Lord. This boss spews golden fire and summon red lightning, and has the ability to teleport.

[spoiler]Placidusax is found in the secret timeless arena hidden below Crumbling Farum Azula.[/spoiler]

title: hoarah_loux
body:
[b]Hoara Loux[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is one of the notable [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] mentioned during the introduction of the game.

[spoilers]After becoming Elden Lord, Hoarah Loux changed his name to [[godfrey first elden lord|Godfrey]].
other_names: 蛮地の王ホーラ・ルー

title: serosh_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Serosh[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is the beast regent of [[godfrey first elden lord|Godfrey, the First Elden Lord]], and serves to hold his rage at bay.

[spoiler]Serosh is killed by Godfrey as he changes to his true form, [[Hoarah Loux]], unleashing his suppressed rage.[/spoiler]

title: lichdragon_fortissax
body:
[b]Lichdragon Fortissax[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is a [[western dragon|winged]] [[dragon]] that can conjure and wield [[lightning]].

Fortissax is the [[brother and sister|brother]] of [[Ancient Dragon Lansseax|Lansseax]] and was a good friend of [[Godwyn the Golden]].

[spoilers]Fortissax is a secret, optional boss faced in the final phase of [[fia the deathbed companion|Fia's]] quest, that is nonetheless important to the main story.

title: maliketh_the_black_blade
body:
[b]Maliketh, the Black Blade[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is [spoilers]the shadow of [[Queen Marika the Eternal]].

[spoilers]Maliketh disguises himself as [[gurranq beast clergyman|Gurranq]] for much of the game.[/spoilers]

title: astel_naturalborn_of_the_void
body:
A [[monster|monstrous]] creature of large size, Astel, Naturalborn of the Void is a creature from outer space with [[multiple_wings|multiple]] [[large_wings|large]] [[insect_wings]], housed in a [[skeleton]] of an unknown humanoid creature, the skull of which houses a large [[one-eyed|singular eye]].
It utilizes gravity and magic and its [[extra_arms|extra arms]], [[mandibles]] and [[scorpion_tail|scorpion-esque]] tail to attack its foes.
other_names: 暗黒の落とし子アステール

title: fire_giant_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]The Fire Giant[/b] is a major boss in [[Elden Ring]]. He is found at the Mountaintop of the Giants, next to the Forge of the Giants. The Fire Giant is the last of his kind, having his kind wiped out by [[Godfrey First Elden Lord]] and his army of [[Crucible Knight]]s long before the time of the game. 

This hundred-feet plus tall monster carries a large lid above its head and uses it as his weapon, along with various fire-spewing abilities.

title: rykard_lord_of_blasphemy
body:
[b]Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy[/b], is a character in [[Elden Ring]].

This is [spoilers]the form that Rykard took after being devoured by the [[God-Devouring Serpent]].[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Praetor Rykard]]
other_names: 冒涜の君主ライカード

title: praetor_rykard
body:
[b]Praetor Rykard[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is one of [[rennala queen of the full moon|Rennala's]] and [[radagon of the golden order|Radagon's]] [[family|sons]] and brother to both [[starscourge radahn|Radahn]] and [[lunar princess ranni|Ranni]]. While he is often depicted with [[red hair]] [spoilers]before his transformation[/spoilers] in fan art, a portrait in his home depicts him with [[blonde hair]].

[spoilers]This was [[rykard lord of blasphemy|Rykard's]] demi-god form before he was devoured by the [[God-Devouring Serpent]]

title: pink_valentine
body:
[[Lotte_(company)|]]'s 2020 [[Valentine]]'s Day advertisement campaign, also promoting the company's special edition Pink Chocolate. The promotions focus on three girls who try to connect to their crushes by making Valentine's chocolate.

The main characters - [[Momo_(pink_valentine)|]], [[Akane_(pink_valentine)|]], and [[Yukie_(pink_valentine)|]] - were introduced through "Kokoro Yohou", a collaboration song with the [[utaite|utaite]] [[Eve (musician)|]].

title: running
body:
To move swiftly on foot so that both feet leave the ground during each stride. Differs from [[standing on one leg]] in that the character is leaning forward a bit, has their legs stretched out in a stride, and any loose clothing and/or hair is blowing away from the person's front side. A good example of the running pose is post #19166.

H4. Examples

* !post #8093664

title: stroking
body:
Stroking is the act of repeatedly moving ones hand gently over something or someone, often including a slight, gentle squish. Usually done to show affection, the feeling of being proud of something/someone, or for pleasure.

title: ishima_kaigen
body:
石馬戒厳 ([i]Ishima Kaigen[/i]) is an eighty-two year old [[soldier]] who appears in the [[eroge]] "[[Hanachirasu]]" made by Nitro+ ([[NitroPlus]]). Ishima has the appearance of a small girl with [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]], wearing an [[Imperial Japanese Army]] [[military uniform]] and she fights with a [[katana]].
Ishima is a parody of "[i]Katou Yasunori[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasunori_Kat%C5%8D , appearing as an antagonist in "Aramata Hiroshi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshi_Aramata 's "[i]Teito Monogatari[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teito_Monogatari .
The voice actress for Ishima is "Hokuto Minami":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%8C%97%E9%83%BD%E5%8D%97 , a very famous [[eroge]] voice actress.
Ishima Kaigen appeared later in the Nitro+ 2-D fighting game called "[[Nitro+Royale]]: Heroines Duel". At Ishima's end of the game, or rather her ending itself, is a [[voice actor connection]].

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article 'Hanachirasu'":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanachirasu
* "Hanachirasu Official site":http://www.nitroplus.co.jp/sp/
* "Nitro+Royale: Heroines Duel Official site":http://www.nitroplus.co.jp/pc/lineup/into_14/

title: noah_(nexas)
body:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber]] from [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]]' first generation, also known as Noah Marcellios. Character design by [[No 1Pafu]]. Shares the same character designer with [[Asa Mitsuki]] and [[Stevie McSloff]].

At some point in August 2024, NEXAS removed Noah’s  profile on their website. No expanation was made until the 23rd of the same month and year when he would make an "announcement":[https://x.com/NoahNEXAS/status/1826835291153600598] on his Twitter account saying that he would be graduating from NEXAS and would be stepping away from VTubing in the future.

He has [[brown hair]]. [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]] and [[green eyes]].

His outfit consists of a [[white shirt]], a [[red hoodie]], a [[brown apron]] with [[pin|pins]], [[black pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. He is holding a [[ferret]] in one of his hands.

* !asset #23285401: Profile

h4. External links

* "Twitter account":[https://twitter.com/NoahNEXAS]
* "TikTok account":[https://www.tiktok.com/@noahnexas]

title: m99_(drumrolls_when_the_curtain_rises)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[M99 (girls' frontline)|]]'s fourth skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of an obtainable reward from the Frontline Protocol 'Fun Rehearsal' from 2024.

She wears a [[black dress|black]] [[two-tone dress|and]] [[white dress]], [[white gloves]], [[black footwear|black]] [[dress shoes]], and a rabbit-shaped piece of headwear on her [[hairband]]. She may be accompanied by a number of [[rabbit]]s dressed to a circus theme, and may carry a [[drum]] and [[drumsticks]].

title: demon_horns
body:
The [[horns]] of a [[demon girl]], or [[demon boy]].

They come in two broad varieties:
* short and stubby with an upward/inward curve, as in the emoticon: 😈 Common in simple illustrations and comedy. Similar to [[cow horns]].
* long with elaborate [[curled horns|curvature]]. Common in complex illustrations. Frequently resemble [[sheep horns|sheep]] or [[goat horns]], including a bumpy, textured surface. Alternately, they may appear smooth and metallic.

In both versions, the horns are usually attached to the sides or top of the head. This is in contrast to [[skin-covered horns]], which are usually attached to the forehead.

title: hospital_rokunin_no_ishi
body:
Japanese title: "HOSPITAL. 6人の医師" ("HOSPITAL Roku-nin no Ishi", "Hospital: 6 Doctors")

Trauma Team is a video game for the Wii console. The game is part of the [[Chou Shittou Caduceus|Trauma Center]] series by Atlus. 

Different from the previous games of the series, where players only took part on surgeries, this new entry allows a wider range of medical procedures which include First Response, Diagnosis, Endoscopy, Orthopedics, and Forensics.

h4. Protagonists

* [[CR-S01]] - General Surgeon
* [[Gabriel Cunningham]] - Diagnostician
* [[Hank Freebird]] - Orthopedic Surgeon
* [[Maria Torres]] - Paramedic
* [[Mira Kimishima]] - Medical Forensics Expert
* [[Tomoe Tachibana]] - Endoscopist

h6. Other Characters

* [[Albert Sartre]]
* [[Alyssa Breslin]]
* [[Claire Blunt]]
* [[Darnell Sellers]]
* [[Emma Wilson]]
* [[Esha Patel]]
* [[Navel (hospital rokunin no ishi)|Navel]]
* [[Rosalia Rosselini]]
* [[Shelly Brooks]]



h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trauma_Team

title: beck_(mighty_no._9)
body:
Main protagonist of [i][[Mighty No. 9]][/i], and a spiritual analogue to [[Mega Man (character)|]].

He is the latest creation of [[William White|Professor William White]] and 9th line of the Mighty Numbers. He posses abilities similar to his spiritual predecessor, however he also has the ability to "AcXelerate", which allows him dash quickly around his environment similarly to [[Mega Man X (series)|]] and can be used to not only quickly defeat most weakened enemies, but also gain power-ups from them as well. He also has the ability of "ReXelection", where Beck transforms his body to harness abilities gained from the Mighty Numbers. Like X, Beck has human-like emotions and the ability to think freely, as well as kind-hearted personality, however he has self-doubts about his abilities and being able to live up to his family's reputation.

[spoiler]Beck is also the third attempt of Professor White's ongoing experiments of creating an freely-evolving robot that can manipulate and assimilate Xels, the others being [[ray_(mighty_no._9)|Ray]] and [[trinity_(mighty_no._9)|Trinity]], both of whom ended up with disastrous results, however Beck was the only one that functioned properly.[/spoiler]

Prior to [i]Mighty No. 9[/i], Beck made an early appearance in [i][[Mighty Gunvolt]][/i], a retro-inspired run-and-gun game also produced by Inti Creates alongside [[Gunvolt]] from [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt[/i] and [[ekoro (galgun)|Ekoro]] from [i]Gal☆Gun[/i], as well as its sequel, [i][[Mighty Gunvolt Burst]][/i].
